text: Went there a few weeks ago and I am so ready to go back.. The first thing that you notice is the multiple televisions... and being a sports fan that is right up my alley.. The service is good and the food was great best wings I have had since moving to Phoenix hands down... Can't wait for march madness so i can post up in there and watch all the games. .

Fantastic sports bar located on Bell Road in Phoenix. Wall to wall TV screens showing every type of sport you could imagine! Their food is amazing (White Pizza is worth checking out) and the drinks are relatively priced. Check this place out!
Ruby....   so awsome. .    Keep mixing those drinks.   Great choice on the wings.. sauces...apps.   I'm  a wing and pasta guy from now on.. love this place..
Nancy the bar tender was awesome and the food is fantastic! Everything we've ever ordered here has been great tasting. Portions are more than enough.
This place has spent more effort on tv screens than its food which was dry and tasteless. Total waste of time,Definitely not coming back.

We used to go here all the time but this sports bar was too sports bar for me so now we get our food to go.  The special of pizza and wings is great.  Cheese pizza has a thin crust but not too thin and the sauce is zesty and flavorful.  Wings are well prepared and delish. They also have mussels which are fantastic flavor wise and price wise.  Ribs are also good.Been there alot
Good beer, wings and pizza. A lot of tvs.  Waitress was attentive and prompt. Definitely found bada$$ sports bar.

This place has good food. Nice and clean.  However......with an exception of a few lovely  waitresses and cocktail servers, the majority were a little on the ILL TEMPERED side. One shoved past my company, wasn't nice and seemed to have a bit of a nasty a RBF. Another tossed out wings down after saying, "hey, is this your food?" Otherwise, it was great.
This bar is amazing. They have an app for your phone heartv...you can listen to what you want...lots of tvs...great food and awesome service!!!

Had a company lunch here and it was bar-fantastic. The buffet pizza and wings were really good. I was also impressed with their chilled beers. Nearly as cold as TP's. It's a little too dark for my taste, but definitely won't mind If we have another lunch here.
This is the spot for a good time! Pizza is awesome, the staff was great. Tv's everywhere this is a sports lovers dream!
Love this place.   Great atmosphere,  great beer selection and amazing food for a sports bar.  Can't beat their wings and pizza is good too

This is the worst bar to goto. The waitresses don't know how to serve properly and they're pretty rude. A lot of their food doesn't taste good. Their pizza is more greasy than Sardellas. The hamburgers are flat but round. Their spicy barbeque wings are pretty good. They have free wifi but constant problems with it. Only other thing is good about this place is all the tvs.

Definitely the spot to go to watch the game or multiple games at once.  There has to be almost 200 TV's in the place.  Also fun to play darts there and I know they have Poker Nights too.   Their food however is NOTHING but typical bar food.  Fried, greasy, and way overpriced in my opinion.  $12 for a burger??? WHAT?  And their pizza, I have heard is good, have never tried but way overpriced as well for what it looks like to me.  I do like that they seem to have a vast selection of choices - salads too.  Stromboli and Calzones are on the menu as well.  I also notice that they have daily drink and food specials (nothing to get excited about price wise either).  The service was good, and always has been good there in my experience, so I am not discrediting that.  I will keep going there, but not to eat!  If you want greasy bar fare, there are a MILLION places nearby that are way more affordable.

Our first time. We will be coming back. Food was wonderful and delicious. Price not bad. So many TVs to choose and watch. Staff friendly and happy. Perfect place for family or date. You guys are awesome!!!

Santisi's is a very cool place. The food is surprisingly very good. Most sports bars have average at best food but these guys are going on 20 years now and it's been that long for a reason... The reason being that the food is good! Period. The other reason is that the service is awesome as long as your not a butt head. The bar tenders are really cute and absolutely professional. So are the servers. Very cool girls! I've been going there now for six months and I promise that you can't go wrong as long as you aren't a jackass. They won't put up with nonsense. They don't need to. My name is Joe. I can't figure out how to make my profile legit but I will. My only complaint with this place is the 2 o'clock start. They need to post up at 11. They do Friday sat and sun, but would be there a lot more often if they 86th the late start during the week. They won't. They obviously know what they're doing. If you don't like santisi's it's on you.

Ok... Bottom line awesome awesome food!! I swear they have old ladies in the back stirring up the most bad good food for you ever... The portions are HUGE like literally 2 people can eat off a plate....  Plenty of TV's lol as they do sell their selves for this... What I like best is all the games are on opposite side  of building so no worries.... This place is for everyone young and young at heart alike...,,

santisis is a place for any sports fan. this looks like some stupid little place from the outside, but it's large and is divided into 2 bar areas. one are is the main large bar with a variety of tables, the big bar, and numerous tvs. the other area is a smaller bar area with tables, darts, pool tables, and a smaller bar.   THERE ARE POSITIVES AND NEGATIVES.  the positives:  there are NUMEROUS FLOOR TO CEILING, AND WALL TO WALL tvs. there's tvs on every inch of the walls, large and small. you will see all sports all over the place.  the menu is extensive ranging from your typical wings, to italian, to seafood, to pizza, to barbeque. they are known for their excellent pizza. they do have a happy hour, but i only believe it's for their draft beer and they are known for their monster beers, i think $3.00 or $3.50. the bar is big with alot of tables. large outdoor smokers patio.   the negatives:  it's very dark, almost like a big cave. there are no windows. it gets very crowded and the tables are practically on top of one another. there is zero room to manuever around all of the different tables without knocking into someone. there are alot of really drunk people in here so it doesn't help that there is super limited room to get around.  there are no reduced food prices for happy hour. COME ON, every bar in the entire area accept for padre murphys has reduced food prices or free food during happy hour. they have a $9.00 buffet on fridays from 11-1 with all you can eat wings, pizza, and a couple other things.  their happy hour drink prices are fairly limited depending on what you drink. regular priced drinks are on a higher end. the beer is ok, but if you start drinking shots and mixed drinks, it's higher then other sports bars. their menu items are pricey. just a basket of chicken strips is over $9.00 .  other items range from $7.50-$16.00 .  if you want to watch sports here, GET HERE ATLEAST 1 1/2  HOURS EARLY. gamedays are extremely crowded. the service is actually pretty good considering how busy they are. even though they have tons of tvs, they'll have something stupid on some of them that no one wants to watch, and have the important games on the others, so just because there's alot of tvs, doesn't mean you'll have a clear view of the game you want. and they won't turn the stupid things off. BEWARE, if you are a soda or iced tea drinker, they will give you 1 free refill and charge you for all the rest. they DON'T tell you that until you see multiple charges on your bill.   so, sports,  really good.  tons of tvs. quality food, but pricey.  no food specials for happy hour. ok drink specials on happy hour only. otherwise, drinks are higher then other places. great pizza. very cramped.  suggestion; GO TO RT OSULLIVANS 59 AVE & BELL RD if you want a nicer sports bar with better pricing and also has a huge amount of plasmas everywhere.

More TV's in one place than I've ever seen!! Good selection of cold beers & cocktails and don't go anywhere else for Friday Night fish fry. Huge portions, good food, but the WORST SERVICE EVER and they don't seem to care. The girls all stand around talking with one another where they place orders at the bar, and wander of to take orders or get you something when THEY feel like it, not when you have a need. They don't care, nor seemingly does management as it's always the same. So go for a drink, enjoy the food, but do NOT expect decent service. But do tip accordingly!!

Let me go ahead and say it. This is the best sports bar in the entire Phoenix area.  Everything is affordable. The pizza is exceptional, and all of the food in general is great. The servers have always been very attractive. It packs in a crowd, and there are some very intense sports fans in the place.  Most notably, Santisi Brothers has what is called the "Wide Wall of Sports". I believe there is somewhere on the low side of 100-150 TVs in this place, and it really is not that huge. The wall is quite literally covered with TVs. There are some main screens which are extremely large that the main events go on, but you can watch anything you want on the smaller TVs.  As someone who bets on college football, I can really appreciate a place where I can go in and watch some obscure game that is important to me and almost no one else. I'm able to get a TV to myself while enjoying a really, really, good pizza. Can't beat that.  These are the reasons why this place has grown so substantially. I've watched this place go from mildly crowded on NFL Game Day to packed every single night. It deserves the business every bit. They do a great job.  One day I was in Santisi's with a friend watching a game. We had ordered a pizza. There was a half eaten slice left on his plate. We had finished eating quite awhile ago and were sitting there watching the game. I was confused as to why the server hadn't taken the plate with the half eaten pizza away. Eventually I told her she could take it. Apparently she understood that I was confused as to why she hadn't taken it earlier, and she told me, "Sorry, I've just learned that you never take food off a man's table unless he's well prepared for it." Amen.   Yep, best sports bar in the city.  Oh yeah, don't try to park in the front. There's a huge parking lot back behind the building.
Cool place! TVs everywhere! Music! Game room! And ribs that fall apart in your mouth from being so moist and tasteful!

3rd update: This is my favorite sports bar. Practically anywhere you sit there is a good view of a tv. There's a few decent craft beer choices on tap. The typical bar food is good but it's the pasta and grill items that are amazing.  The angel hair with grilled tomato, garlic, chicken in olive oil is light but filling. The baked ziti is a big cheesy dish but get it with meatballs. The alfredo is rich, thicc, and tastes homemade.  The chicken and pork chop pieces are huge. They're all griddled with a good sear but still juicy inside.   The wings are some of the best; a bit crispy with a medium that tastes like medium, hot that's actually hot, etc. Lemon pepper is still addicting.  The calamari recipe changed a few years ago and the breading was super dense and dry. But just recently the breading is back to light but crispy.  With football around the corner it can get crazy. Get there early and it can be even more chaotic during shift changes around 4pm. If you don't see a server just get one of the bar backs guys or food runner girls to get them. It helps to know your server's name, too. They're all usually friendly and attentive. :)

This is a great sports bar to watch any game on their selection of TVs that coat the walls inside. The pizza is good but nothing outstanding. The waitresses are nice but sometimes the service is slow because it's usually packed on weekends. All together this is a good place to sit down and watch a game with your friends.

We went here a couple weeks ago....honestly, wayyy disappointed.  Ordered a pizza with a couple toppings...came out and just really was not done hardly at all and cheese tasted gross and super super cheap. Not good. Never going back! The only thing that made it better was our Four Peaks beer
I live down the street from this bar and i always have an amazing time. The staff is always friendly and the food is great. The drinks are pretty well priced. Its overall a great place!!

If you are going to watch a game and eat game food, it might be OK.  However we were told by someone they had "pretty decent" Italian food.  Maybe they were referring to the pizza because the pasta left a lot to be desired.  Neither dish ordered by us had much flavor.  One was swimming in poor quality olive oil and the sauce on the other tasted like one of those canned things you give kids when you're in a hurry.   Bottom line - for booze and bar food, probably fine but skip the pasta.
It's football heaven for fans. Good attentive service. Been going there whenver Cardinals play away games.
We go every  Sunday night after softball. The Abita is ice cold and the food is great. Our server Katelyn does a great job taking care of us.

Been here a few times and every time the food is just great.  Keep trying new things and never disappointed.  Service is good and of course so are the drinks.  Big time sports bar with TV's everywhere you look, so if you are looking for a quiet meal this isn't the place, but if your looking for a lively time or wanting to watch the game with good food and drinks this is the place.

Visiting AZ for spring training and golf. After a round of golf we want to check out a sports bar for beer and food. This was a great pick. The walls a covered with TVs, the staff is friendly, the food is great and the beer is cold. Great sports bar!
Debbie was awesome and needs to be the boss! Been in here a few times and her customer service was on point tonight.
Great place to watch football! Great beer selection. The food is ok..but you cant beat the atmosphere for games.
It's a cool place to hang out and grab a beer after work, or even on the weekends.  Personally, I like the large smoking patio for those times that I want to light up.

My buddies and I showed up on a Wednesday night (4/19/17) and Bailey was our server on the bar side of the restaurant. Her charming attitude and friendly smile made her seem like an instant friend. Her attentiveness and being quick with refilling our drinks were very appreciated. We will return because of her.

Absolutely love Santisi Brothers! No matter what I order on the menu it always brings me pleasure. From family dinner to a night out with friends Santisis is definitely the way to go. Portions are huge, drinks are fantastic, and all around everything is well priced! The weekly poker, karaoke, and bingo just add on to wonderful atmosphere created by the TV surrounded sports bar. No questions asked I'd recommend Santisi Brothers no matter what every time!

I do like the food here. It seems that recently though they stopped posting any carryout menu item prices online. I'm not a bar guy anymore but I have ordered take out from here many times and maybe I just wasn't paying attention before but I was in for a little surprise the other night. I ordered a standard 16" Veggie pie and a dozen wings and the tab seemed crazy high to me: $33+ ! I asked to see the register  receipt thinking a mistake had been made and saw that the pizza was almost $23.00. Maybe they are unaware of this but that is A LOT for  regular 5 item pizza. For $23.00 I'm looking for Chicago deep dish loaded...$15 or $16 is more in line for the product tier in this case.  Just a little reality check that restaurants need from time to time

If you haven't been to Santisi Brothers before you definitely need to make a trip or two.  Whether you want to bring your family down for dinner, hang out for happy hour, watch UFC, or play poker Santisi's has it all.    There is an extensive menu so no matter what you want they will have it.  If you love wings you have to try the lemon pepper or Gio BBQ.  Pizza is always a good choice and try the specialty pizzas if you want something a little different than the basic pepperoni or sausage.  There is a soup of the day, Saturday's Creamy Chicken Noodle is my favorite, but there are other great soups such as Chicken Tortilla on Tuesdays and Clam Chowder on Fridays!  Fish Fry on Fridays and Crab legs on Wednesdays and Saturdays are also great choices.  Even if you want to eat healthy you can have one of their great salads or go with pork chops or chicken breast...if you do make sure you get the grilled zucchini as a side!   Santisi's is definitely a family friendly environment as my son and I make it a weekly ritual to come in and eat on Tuesday nights.  The servers are very personable and work hard to make sure you enjoy your time.     I was glad that they picked up the UFC fights a few years back because I use to have to leave poker and find somewhere else to watch UFC.  And if you like to play poker and have a chance to win a $1000 WSOP seat Santisi's is the place to come.    Santisi Brothers in my opinion is the best Sports Bar that I have ever been too.  The food, service, and experiences are great!

Last night was my first night venturing to Santisi Bros as a fairly large group of us were getting together since we hadn't seen each other in a while.  I always thought how a restaurant handles large groups is what makes or breaks them.  I was disappointed in the wait staff.  It took about a half hour before we actually went inside and asked for a server.  And even then, we only saw her one more time after bringing our food before she vanished for another half hour.  We had to find her to close out our tab before we hit the inside for karaoke.  A good first impression this does not make.  Now, I don't want to make this a wholly negative review.  The food was outstanding.  I didn't hear a single person have a problem with their food.  I had the Chicken Parmesan sub with onion rings. I was thoroughly impressed with the onion rings as the batter appeared to have been done by hand.  Very VERY tasty.  Once we ventured inside, it was a very different story.  The wait staff was much friendlier and far more visible around our table, catching drink orders and in one case, belting out an awesome karaoke track that I, unfortunately, forget the title.  The beer was ice cold and seemed to stay that way the entire time it was in my mug.    The rest of the night was very fun and enjoyable.  I look forward to going back again soon.
Came on a Saturday and the place was great...food good, booze was flowing and the darts were flying.

Excellent place to watch a game, grab some food and have a drink!  Not your typical sports bar, this place is more like a sports bar on steroids!  Tons of Tv's and restaurant quality food with an impressive menu.  Everything I have tried has been delicious and you really can't get better ribs anywhere in the valley.  The White Pizza is to die for and the Giovani wings are fantastic. Great place for UFC and they even have poker 3 days a week.  Can't say enough about the atmosphere, food and people.

Haven't been here in many years, but decided to have a night with some friends that landed us here last night. I won't lie; I was expecting to be ignored by the bar staff and servers throughout the night and pay highly for watered down drinks. Much to my surprise, the atmosphere was amazing! Multiple tvs tuned to anything from hockey to UFC and more, friendly servers ready to help with anything you may need, and a restaurant/bar full of smiling, happy faces! And our bartender Jessie was fast, amazing, and just all around a pleasure to have serving us. We will definitely be back!!
Love the atmosphere and the food is great! Soooo many TVs, perfect for football!  If you go request to sit in Lindsey's area...she's the best!

Still love Santisis!  It's my regular spot on the way home from work and love to try new things everything I'm there.  We had the Philly Cheeses teak sliders this time and they were awesome!  I always have to get a side of Giovanni BBQ sauce with absolutely  everything I get, I think I might be slightly addicted it it.  Haha.  Staff is great, always helpful and the service time is fantastic.  Even when it's busy, they take care of each customer with care and speed.

Tasty food but over priced for the usual bar food. With that said it is a great atmosphere with plenty of entertainment, you won't miss a game! Staff is great and they offer decent drink specials. I'll be back for the decent beer selection!

I wish I didn't have to rate one star because it isnt even worth that. The food is absolutely amazing! But our service was the worst I have ever had. She had no knowledge of what was in what or anything about what I was trying to order. I feel bad for anybody who has Marcella as a waitress because that was just unacceptable!
wings were good peperoni pizza burger was good. service was horrible waitress was rude took over 20 minutes to get a refill and you only get one free refill
Been going to this place since it's inception and must say, they use the best ingredients which makes their food taste incredible. Hope they keep doing what their doing...

I dont appreciate being treated this!  I tried to play pool with a friend and a waitress came by and stood at the other end of the pool table starring at me but didnt say anything. Then I asked if there was a problem. She said uhh are you guys going to buy drinks? My friend said we already have beers in the eating area. So she kept starring like she didn't want us there. Then she turned around and walked away. She was not friendly or polite to us. I didnt want to play anymore. I wasnt going to have a good time if a employee was rude to me. If she was nicer i would have been in a better mood and i was planning on ordering something after i played pool. I dont like their food but i would have gotten something anyway. There were some other things that weren't okay with me while I was  there. I was forced to be there with family but I would never choose to go to this place. I've been here 3 times before and every time I was unsatisfied with the food. Its just not an inviting place. Ive never said anything before but this time I had to post about them. They dont always have the sport you want to watch playing on their tvs.

This was our first time here. The server was a complete ___! Megan was her name. The overall feel of the place was pretty good. The food looked pretty good. Service was horrible, so I didn't get far enough to get the full experience.

You can't go wrong with the fabulous delicious wings from Santisi! That among other great choices off the menu are incredible! I have never had a bad experience at one. This one stands out due to our server ERICA whom was very attentive! Erica took our order very promptly and continued to check back to make sure everything was exactly as we had requested. She anticipated our needs and filled them without asking. Her attitude was the best I have ever seen. Erica recommended the "Green Tea shot" and "Puerto Rican Kiss shot" which both were amazing!   Ask for Erica! She'll take great care of you! We need more servers like her. She gives Santisi Brothers FIVE STARS!!!!!!!!!
Beyond amazing. Love all the TV's.  My sister introduced me and fell in love.  Huge plates, drinks and beer.  Everyone is so nice too.  Can get very crowded and loud but...It's a bar!
Love this place! Great food and their bartender,  Debbie, is great...always friendly and takes a personal interest in all her guests!

You choose how and where to spend your money. Invest in supporting a local family-owned business. We find the staff and owners to be real and helpful. Quite cute too! Do it family style, share a large salad, pizza, and the best meatballs. We like ours with the mozzarella melted on top!  My husband wont leave without the caramel drizzled cheesecake! YUM.  See you soon brothers.

Santisi's is our go to place for girls night. They have good drinks at a good price and the food is better than average.   The veggie basket is big enough for 4 of us to split and I can tell that they are cut fresh.   There are a ton of TV's with every event imaginable and pool tables and darts in the back. the music is never so loud we can't talk.   Then outdoor seating is great in the winter with several heaters.

I have no idea if there food is any good, I walked all over the restaurant to find a table! All tables are first come first serve, there was 3 or 4 4-top tables with one guy sitting at them. All of the 6 or 8 tops only had 3 people sitting there. The waitresses wouldn't even speak to us. When I did speak to one waiter he looked at me and walked right past. I walked up to the bar to talk to a waitress and she was super rude. First come first serve on a busy night is bad business, wasting an entire 8 top table on three people, not to mention 3 or 4 tables. There would have been plenty of room to seat more people had there been any structure. I had 5 people with me that would have been buying drinks and food, there loss. We won't be visiting this establishment again!

I absolutely love Santisi Brothers!! I've been coming here for over a year now, and have never once had a bad experience. All of the servers are friendly and fantastic! The pizza (especially the white pizza) are amazingly good! I actually just adopted a vegan diet and I have had no issue altering different menu items to conform to my diet restrictions, and the staff is always happy to make those changes for me. There is no better place to hang out for some great food, beer, and to watch a game or UFC fight!

Slow, and will say it again slow. We got there at 1:00 ordered by 10 after and after complaing got our food to go a 1:50. Wish it was the 1st time but the 4th at least in the last year. It was not busy and bartenders seem to not care unless you start complaining. We always order one of the specials of the day. Not the only place in town with televisions. We will not be bac k, gave enough chances but feel to many times to not be a normal occurrence. Food is not that great to sacrifice our time waiting.

We've been going to Santisi for close to 10 years since they are just around the corner from my house. We've never had a bad item here. It's a fun place to go and the food is great. We always order pizza which is consistently good. Their salads are excellent - all their ingredients are very fresh and there's enough for two meals if you're a lighter eater. And the wings are always excellent.   We've always had good service and the staff keeps the beverages coming. It's a great place to watch a game - if you can get in! Friday and Saturday nights are so crowded we often grab a beer while we wait for our take-out pizza. The parking can be a challenge since the stripes are laid out weird and there's a dollar theater next door. You can park in back (the side toward the freeway) if there's no room in the front.  We moved away in 2006 and came back in 2010 and Santisi was still there, and as good as ever.
This is a must go for us when we're in town... Love the Giovanni chicken wings and the Italian donuts!!! Yummy!!!
Food was decent but on the expensive side. The games on sports tv channels was comprehensive.
Good atmosphere tv's everywhere for sports. Food is amazing especially for a sports bar.

I'm a little belated with this review, but I can't say enough great things about our recent experience at Santisi Brothers. We hosted my daughter's college graduation party there and they did an exceptional job in all aspects. Working with Toni Santisi was such a treat! She handles all the big parties and special events. Getting to work with Toni and having her exceptional service, knowledge and experience as a party planner included in the deal is a major added perk to hosting an event at Santisi Brothers. The food was great, the staff was friendly, professional and responsive and the patio was so perfect for my party of 50. I was able to book the entire patio for our party and set up a great buffet. I have hosted many parties at other restaurants over the years, and I have never experienced such superior customer service. Toni asked me to bring many of my decorations the day prior to the party and when I arrived on party day, the patio already looked amazing. As I worked to set up the additional decorations, several staff members kept popping up to assist. I never would have expected this additional effort. Our server for the evening was Kelli and she was amazing! My guests were coming at her from all different directions with beverage orders and she was on top of everything. She is such an asset and so, so good at her job! Toni did such a great job setting up a lovely buffet with a couple different kinds of wings in a sterno, large bowls of salads and different pizzas. The food was so well received by my guests that we had to re-order a few different times. Toni stayed all over this for me and kept checking what I wanted to do so my guests never had to wait long for more food. Their pizza is delicious, the salads were yummy (we had garden salad and mandarin spinach salad) and the Giovanni wings were a huge hit. I received so many compliments on what a great party it was and what a great selection Santisi Brothers had been. I noticed people walking past the patio also commented on how great everything looked and that they would keep that spot in mind for their next big celebration. I know I will for sure bring more business back to them and would love to work with both Toni and Kelli again. Huge Thanks to Toni, Kelli and everyone else at Santisi Brothers for making my daughter's special occasion such a wonderful, perfect evening in every way!

If you're looking for a great place to watch your favorite sporting event or game you need to check out Santisi Brothers. It doesn't matter what game or event you're looking for, they will have it playing somewhere. I'm a Browns fan so sometimes it is hard to find a place that actually plays our games on TV. But they have over 100 TVs so I'm always able to find our game on a big screen somewhere. Sundays are the best. The place is packed with enthusiastic fans cheering and having a good time. There is a lot of space and seating but on Sundays it fills up fast so be sure to get there early and stake claim to your spot. The food is great and not like your usual bar food. They have great pizza and Italian dishes and sandwiches. And the Giovani flavored wings are amazing. The drinks are cheap and the service is fast. They have a great Happy Hour too. They also have a game room with pool tables, darts and other fun activities so it's not just a place to watch sports. There is plenty of parking. They also have an outdoor patio with TVs and a lot of seating. There is two full service bars and the bartenders are quick. I would definitely recommend this place.

having recently moved here from near Old Fordge Pennsylvania, dubbed by national media as "the pizza capital of the world", i was a little skeptical on what the pizza scene would be like out west. after hearing some pizza-horror stories from local friends who have ventured out, it didnt look good.   i found this place after seeing it voted as best pizza in phoenix and was definitely surprised at how good it was! i feel a slight sense of relief knowing that despite seemingly popular opinion, theres still some killer pizza in AZ, and this place is it!   only con, pizza is slightly pricey. i paid $13 for a medium plain pie.

First off... The Wings rule.  The Giovanni ones are amazing.   Chicken tenders are legit too.  Love the tvs. Only complaint... Charging for ice tea refills????  Really.... Ice tea refills?  Come on santisis, lamest thing I've ever heard....I'll order water from now on, bring my own bag, and tea bag my water myself.  If you are gonna charge for ice freaking tea refills, which no other restaurant on the planet does, your servers should at least let your guest know. It's only 3 bucks, not a money issue.  Definately the principle.  I'll be back, cause like I said.... Wings are legit.
Went today with a friend while our wives were at a bridal shower, and everything was perfect! Great wings, great pizza, great service, and great atmosphere.
Great ambiance and food! If your looking for a place to hang out with friends and catch a game....look no further!

Let's start by announcing this is one of my FAVORITE Friday night hot-spots. We always sit at the bar. Maybe our familiarity with the flawlessness that is Friday night at the bar at Santisis is where the problem lies. Went there today for Father's Day and the seemingly warm waitress pointed out, "You got here at the same time everyone else did!" I candidly replied, "we BROUGHT them all here ;)" with a playful attitude. At first it seemed harmless enough, our initial beer orders were handled with grace but the food was a bit delayed given the crowd- as I said we are used to the Friday night bustle with one bartender, Debbie, who doesn't even sweat with the craziness. We got our food, the server seemed put out and when my fiancé politely asked for another sauce as the bartender's leisurely replied, "you're going to have to give me a minute, you only ordered two." And I get it-it may sound petty but it was a kind request returned with hostility. I understand you're busy. Santisi is busy because the food and drinks are amazing! And in general the service is too. So I let that one slide. About the time we were about done eating about ten minutes later, the bartender brought the sauce my fiancé requested- without eye contact or verbal response. Twenty minutes later I decided to place my payment up for grabs. No one had been by to ask how the food was, If we would like more drinks or if we needed anything else. Sitting at the bar usually means attentive service, however today this was not the case. I was frustrated at being ignored so I put up a "went outside for a smoke" paper on my bar spot. We had a few chicken strips left which I wanted to bring home but, again no one had offered to help. I sat outside and finished my beer in peace and upon my arrival to the bar the bartender informed me I wasn't  "allowed" to go outside without leaving a payment/card. I thought this was ironic and explained to her that I had been trying to pay for a bit and was ignored so I went outside where it was quieter to drink my beer. Let me yet say that I was standing up for the waitresses' attitude until this point. I was a server for over seven years in my past life, I understand what it's like to be busy. Nonetheless I was frustrated, as was my fiancé, as we were not accustomed at all to this treatment. At the end of the transaction the bartender remarked that I had lost my partner, I felt no qualms about informing Nancy that he had left because he wouldn't tolerate her rudeness. She seemed put off and apologized for being busy. I explained that I was accustomed to visiting Santisi on Friday nights, when it was WAY busier than today and that Debbie never seemed to have an issue. I commented that maybe she wasn't suited for such a busy atmosphere- she replied "thank you".

Went to Santisi Brothers for the Super Bowl, it was GREAT!! Flat screens everywhere not a bad seat in the place. The food was excellent, perfectly cooked wings with many different flavor choices and the service was OUTSTANDING!! Thanks to our server Michelle Mathews, The place was packed, she was really busy but we never had to wait for anything!! Best sports bar ever!!!  Thanks,  Mike Doyon

I usually like this place but night the service was bad and the pasta with sausage was not edible. The sausage tasted like fake meat and the pasta was over cooked and mushy. Very disappointed. The server seemed irritated and very inattentive.
Tons of TV's and really nice servers. Took care of my family who were in town 4 different nights on our trip with tables of 12 to 15 people. The food is really good and they are great!
Quick update to this post. Toni Santisi reached out as a result of our review and her genuine interest in our satisfaction was very much appreciated.
I must say I am very impressed with how our complaint was handled. I couldn't have asked for better service

Outstanding. Was staying in a hotel nearby while visiting for a job interview and it was the closest place to watch the 2012 bcs nat championship game. over 100 tv's, great staff, and outstanding food. If you live in the area and havent been you havent lived period.
It's a good place to go hang out with a bunch of friends.  I probably wouldn't go there just to eat dinner.

I've eaten here twice now.  First time I had the 4 mini beef hotdogs.  If you like hotdogs try these.  I love that they toast the buns.  The service was not the best this night.  Dishes and empty glasses were left on the table while many servers and busboys walked right by them. I went again for Sunday football after seeing all the t.v's they had and being from MI it's hard to find a place to watch the Lions play that has decent t.v's. We sat up to the bar and Nanci was the bar tender.  EXCELLENT service! She explained quite a few of the menu items and drinks I ate the half order of sausage and peppers and onions.  WAYY too much food but so tasty.  My husband had the mediterranean pizza and was impressed with the crust and flavor of it all.  We will be back for sure.
Coldest beer in town!  Santisi Brothers is the hands down best place to watch sports.   Week after week we get fantastic service and delicious food.  Highly recommend the wings.
overpriced you definitely pay for all the tvs in there. Service was slow  almost walked out because no one came to our table the first 15 minutes we were there.
Always an awesome place to go! It's the only good thing going on in that entire corner.   The pizza and wings are bomb!

I was at this establishment for a karaoke night. The food was good, the drinks were good, and the service was good. No complaints there.  As for the karaoke crowd that was there, I was VERY disappointed. A lot of people were comfortable with the N-word being blatantly  thrown out there over the microphone. It was as if this was the norm around there.   If that is the crowd that frequents this place then so be it. I do not think I will be coming back to this place any time soon.  Bottom line: If you have to question whether or not you should sing the N-word in a song...you probably shouldn't.

The food is excellent but if you're hungry definately get an order of garlic knots with marinara because service is really slow.  If you are a sports can this is the place for you if you are looking for a quiet dinner conversation go somewhere else.
Manager rudely came out after we spent 40$ saying the patio is not dog friendly when I had my service dog with me. I'll take my business else where.

Huuuuu Jass Sports Bar.  Ok, I normally don't care for sports bars but this one rocks my socks.  I discovered this place when I first moved to Phoenix and would get off at 11pm starving.  Holy cow they have awesome marinara!  I would order a stromboli or calzone and it came with a soup cup of marinara if you asked.  I could eat half and have breakfast in the morning.    This place has very equitable pricing especially during reverse HH.  Seriously huge beers for $5 and two-meal worthy dishes for around $10.  And then there is the most kickass thing of all... Buzztime trivia!  As previously mentioned I am not a sports fan.  Because they have oodles of televisions they always leave a few on Buzztime, yay!  To wit, there is an active unit of regulars who play so there is always a challenger available.  I don't think I have ever been in there and had to play alone for more than a game.  The servers are pretty good but there is one teeny-tiny mature bartender lady (can not remember her name) who has to be one of the best bartenders in the Valley as far as I am concerned.  This woman is amazing, she holds down a long bar, never gets a tab wrong and fends of weirdos with expertise.   Santisi's is a good place to meet with west-siders as you each have to come a distance but not too far and the experience is worth it.  Why not five stars?  I once got 2 bills pinched off me in the bathroom in a drunken state and I dislike the super-high speed bumps you must cross to head east on Bell from their complex or flip a bitch on Bell where it is 6 lanes wide.  Neither of these things will stop me from going there though.

If you want excellent service..... you have to seat with Leslie!! She's the best santisis has!! Definitely not like your typical boring server!!! The food here is also bomb! I haven't tried something that I didn't like so far.... A+++++
For carry out you have to get the special 16 inch pizza and 36 wings they have it everyday carry out only for $35 unbelievably good

First - as a sports bar, they are the BEST I've ever seen.  More TV's in HDef than can be counted.  And they were very accommodating, so that I could watch the SEC out on the west coast.  Now on to the wings.  As far a size, A, selection, B-, too many confusing/similar names, e.g.- honey-hot, honey BBQ, BBQ hot, Dino's BBQ, Gio's BBQ, etc.  Plus, the waitress couldn't even explain the difference. I got the Gio's & the Med Buffalo.  Now for the biggest complaint - as with all places that do this.  Minimum of 10 wings per flavor, no exception.  Even during their $0.55/wing special, I have to get 40 wings to try 4 of their sauces.  Sorry, I can't waste that much food/money.  Why is it so hard to throw 5 wings in a bowl to toss?  The Gio's tasted good but weren't real distinctive, like corn syrup and Frank's combined.  The seasoned fries were crisp & flavorful but not 'fresh cut'.  Lots of great beers on tap, with a friendly staff. My search in PHX continues...
I love this spot- one of my favorites for football watching and adult beverages. Ashley is my girl- best bartender ever.

Great place to hang out and watch sports! Did I mention that the food is fantastic? Pizza and Calzones like my best friend Vito makes back in NY. I see some of the other comments about the lousy food or service and don't get it.    I have been many times since moving here last summer and have not encountered an issue with staff or food. Just watched UFC 155 this past weekend and our server was great & hot as hell (Allisha) even though it was busy as hell. 32 oz. drafts for $5? all night long...are you kidding me?? I will be back this weekend for the playoffs for sure.

Tried this place out while on a work trip in Phoenix. Wanted above average bar food and good beer selection. I had the 10" Meatza pizza. The crust was a bit undercooked but everything else was great. Loaded with meat. Side salad was fresh & good. I tried several new beers from their decent selection. They were served in huge mugs ice cold.  There are tons of TV's in this place so you can see pretty much watch any game available. The bartender was friendly and very quick.
Love santisi's, the best wings and garlic cheese bread in the valley. Been coming here for years and I love it. Never had anything bad here, except..a couple of dates.

Always like coming to this place. The food is good the service is great. Ashley is my favorite bartender. She is very attentive and always takes care of me and my friends. Drinks are always filled, she makes conversations which is a plus. Overall this place and ashley are great.

What a great place, its big, a bit loud, but so much going on. The kids can play trivia or other games.  The food is really good, the meatballs are homemade! But its the services that makes it great.  The servers there are friendly and fast.
Best sports bar ever! Thanks to John S., I will never eat wings anywhere else again... Their Giovanni wings are the best wings I have ever had.  Keep up the good work Santisi Bros!

My friends and I visited Santisi for my birthday and it was a great experience.  The food was great, love the chicken sliders and wings! Lindsey was our server and she was the best! Very friendly amd attentive! We'll be coming back soon, ill definitely ask for Lindsey again too!
Love this place! Went for Super Bowl Sunday. TV's everywhere!  Service and food ~ excellent!

Santisi Brothers is a great sports bar with hundreds of screens to watch any sporting event you can possibly imagine. The service has always been great, the food is quite good for bar food, and we will be happy to be repeat customers. By the way, the portions are huge and the prices are quite reasonable. Wings are delicious, my son loves the burgers, and the philly cheesesteak is quite good. I have also had the chicken parm sub and it is good, but not saucy enough for me so a little dry. Not a big deal as all the food is of good quality, much better than the majority of sports bar food that you will find in other locations.

Edit: Nancy is rude!!!!! Just got back from grabbing food and beer. Don't think I'll ever be back on a Sunday afternoon.   This is probably my favorite bar. Huge menu, everything is good. Never thought a bar could deliver such amazing dishes. Drink prices are good too. DEBBIE IS THE BEST BARTENDER EVER!!!

Awesome food and friendly staff. This place is PACKED when football is on. It's tucked away in the back of the "mall" parking lot... but its easy to get to and plenty of parking. I like going for the Thursday or Monday night games when its not as crowded.

This place was just ok for me.  They have TONS of TV's - perfect for sports.  They have a restaurant & a bar so you can have your cake & eat it too. Avoid karaoke night....bad bad bad.    The bartender was awesome. She made great drinks and didn't hold back on talking to is about the night.    Best waitress was Lacey.  If you go,  you will want to sit in her area.  Your drinks will never be empty, food hot/fresh & nothing but good things.   I got the gluten free pizza with xtra cheese: sauce was seasoned well so I couldn't tell it was gluten free.  We also ordered the artichoke/spinach dip- the bomb!!

Grimy and grungy bar and questionable patrons. Came here on a groupon and the waitress AND manager argued with us regarding its validity on takeout orders. We had verified on the group in that it was in fact good on takeout. They had no idea what they were talking about. Wouldn't have stayed for dine in due to the disgusting floors, tables, crumbs on the bar and did I mention annoying drunk customers everywhere?  Logic would urge that a business amongst a neighborhood of failed businesses would up the ante on the demand for decent customer service. Other than that, if they cleaned the place up it would be mediocre. A lot of tvs, trivia, and the food smells delicious so far. But overall I don't plan on coming back.

This bar is great!  The people vary. There are ages 21-60 on the bar side and families an kids on the restaurant side.     They have an internet jukebox though it's overpriced :(  and too many people play crap. TONS of rap!  Food is great and drinks are good! I love the wings there. The chicken strips are great too!  yummy!  Lots of cute guys and girls to look at! The atmosphere is pretty cool so people don't tend to get pissy if you talk to them!   It's so fun to watch the UFC fights and its the best when Suns are in playoffs but they play all sporting events.

We visited here for large group gathering- the experience left much to be desired considering we spent approximately $600- we will look elsewhere the next time for a friendlier and more accommodating establishment.
Food's way better than I expected from a sports bar, great specials and drinks, plenty of options and televisions to pick from, pool tables, darts, karaoke night, clean too. I'm a fan

I love this place! Great food, the pizza especially, and huge salads. This is the best place to watch sports. Our server was very accommodating to put MY team, BOISE STATE, on one of the big screens. I highly recommend this place.

I would say 4 stars because they don't have fried zucchini like the menu says!!! The reason for 5 stars is the food is great and Erica is one of the best servers I have ever had hands down!! I will be back for sure just because of her, but they really do need to get the zucchini problem fixed haha

This place has two walls of floor to ceiling tv's, two bars, an area for pool and darts along with lots of tables and high tops.   I've mainly stopped in for karaoke, but they have a great menu. The pizza and wings are good. Drinks are well poured, and I've always gotten good service at the bar. You will see quite a few regulars if you go enough. They have a good sound system for karaoke!  Great place for good food and good times!!

They have a million tv's! You can watch any type of game here. The service is most of the time good, it is a sports bar, so Im sure it gets very busy a lot of times, although I have never been there to witness it myself.   Never tried the food, but the drink specials are good. They have a good selection of beers, not so many craft beers, but a lot of domestics. Their happy hour is till 6:30 which is great, and they have happy hour drink specials as well as food specials.   We will come back here, but its not a place I would tell someone that they HAVE to go to...seems like a good hangout for a lot of epople though, I noticed that there seem to be quite a few regulars who show up each night.

Come on Santisi's !!!! $25 for 1 large pizza? You guys are effing CRAZY! It's not that good! Geez! I had the white pizza, which is tasty but $25!! Hell no!! Never again, lesson learned!!! Next time ill go ANYWHErE else and get 5 pizzas for that price!!!

The Good: The pizza was incredible. I'm from NY and I take my pizza very seriously. The NY hand tossed pizza crust was nice and doughy, I loved it.  The wings were really good too, but the ranch was extremely watery    The Bad: The inside of this place looks like it hasn't been remodeled in 20 years, and there really is no theme to this place. I get that it's a sports bar but it just feels dirty and uninspiring inside. You walk in and there are these thin awkward tables scattered everywhere for you to sit.  The Ugly: the waitresses were the worst I've encountered in AZ. Throughout the 2 hours of being there, they never spoke once, even while taking our order, didn't smile, nothing. None of the employees wanted to be there.   Look this is Phoenix, there are thousands of great places to eat and drink on a Friday. The pizza is good and I'd definitely order for take out in the future, but I can't spend another second of my life inside this place.

Dirty dirty dirty. In a run drown shopping center the place looked closed as well. The staff was not accommodating when asked to move from one side of the bar to another after we have been served our beverages. Pizza was not cooked completely and was so soggy in the middle. I wasn't expecting much from a dark bar but to have customers move for what reason and to be ignored for 10 minutes. Never again will this place take my money

Good food. In town for spring training and wanted good food and good choice of beer. Pizza was good  and we found a couple beers we liked. Within walking distance of our hotel. A little too much visual stimulation but we sat at the right place for Spurs basketball (go Spurs!) and world baseball classic right next to each other. Good choice!

Love this place they have great pizza and ice cold beer. They also have the MMA fights for free. Santisi Borthers is a family owned place and for how large it is you will get to meet and know the family.
Long time favorite. Food never disappoints. Lots of TV's. Bar is dark and can sometime be very crowded when you walk in. Go right, play some pool and be patient while waiting for a table.

This is my new favorite spot in town SANTISI BROTHERS, never a disappointment. Great atmosphere. Friendly Staff with a smile. With a food menu where anything you choose is delicious.  you'll Thank me later!

Looking for a sports bar?  Look no further. There's TV's on every inch of wall and then some. They also have darts and pool. The unlimited fish on Fridays is amazing!  Our waitress Nancy was awesome, too. Great beer selection!

Nice sports bar to catch the game on a Sunday morning.  We arrived at 9:30 to grab a table, and I was amazed how many TVs they had on all the walls. Awesome. There's even a map on each table to show which TV will show which football game for both the morning and afternoon schedule.  Brunch buffet was alright. They had eggs, biscuits w/ gravy, breakfast burritos, sausages, pizza, wings, etc. Only until 11 though, then they offer the regular menu.  Had a couple huge beers while watching the game, and later needed a nap after the game. lol!! My sister got an appetizer sampler with sliders, wings, and fried zucchini. Mmm...delicious!  Service was really good as our waitress constantly brought me fresh coffee, refilled our drinks, and checked to see if I wanted another beer.  A great place to watch some football on Sunday. They even have free wifi so you fantasy addicts can keep up on all the latest stats. ;P

Stayed at a hotel nearbye, looked for pizza in the area, Santisi had high reviews and looked great.  Made an order for a Pepperoni pizza and wings..   Picked it up, bar looked awesome, super friendly staff, more tv's than you could imagine.  Cant expect more out of a sports bar, good food, staff and entertainment.  If I am in the area again Im def coming back.

My neighbors turned me on to Santisi Brothers over a night of pizza and beer. Most recently I visited with my mom and hubby for a night of, well.....pizza and beer.   The food here is great, with a nice selection for vegetarians. Try the garlic knots! They are soft, tasty knots of dough served with tomato sauce. Mmm. Cheese pizza was piled with cheese and the dough was perfection.  Service was slow, but the waitress was super sweet and changed the tv to the game our group wanted to watch.

I"m late in posing my review. We went there to watch an ASU game. Even though it was crowded our server was attentive. The chicken wings were awesome. The chicken strips were the bomb!. They were home made and not frozen. The had taste and were fresh. I can't say anything bad about this place. The ambiance is great and its entertaining to watch.
Always a good time..best food !!! ..service is always efficient and conistant ..I love the crab legs on Saturday ..such a great price for what you get ..lb

Santisi Brothers ranks in my top five of all sports bars with exceptional food that I've been to in my life.  I've had the pleasure of touring their massive kitchen, which is very clean and organized.  Their extensive menu is loaded with great choices that you absolutely can't go wrong with.  Daily specials that you really want to go for, especially crab legs on Weds and Thurs. The Fish n Chips on Friday and the pizza, wings, baked ziti bar on Friday's is off the charts!  Worth the drive from anywhere in the valley to come to Santisi Brothers!  It's a great operation across the board, much Love and respect...

This place is a TV Time Machine to the 80's.  Tons upon tons upon assloads upon bajillions of TV's in this place . . . sadly 95% of them are old tubes or old projection TV's.  Thumbs up though for how willing they were to change a TV to the game you wanted.  Not much for outside patio TV's though.  I think three total, and poorly angled.  Angel matters.  The food was standard bar fare.  The wings though were excellent, some of the best I've had . . . well cooked and plenty of sauce.  Service was great    Nothing I'd go out of my way for, but if peeps were going and I was in the area I'd go back

This is just overall a great place! It's tough to do this review, as I can probably only remember 1/2 of my times being here, and that is being generous.  There's something about the atmosphere here that just makes you want to tie one on and knock back giant beers and spend money playing songs, darts, and Golden Tee. They also have pool and other games.  It's a BIG bar. There is a more "game side" and a more "table/eating side". They have a ton of TV's that are large and high quality. I have never seen it "slow" here. It seems no matter what the day or time it's pretty happening!  The food is really good. I love the diverse menu, happy hour specials, and quality ingredients. I also have never once had bad service. The staff is fast, friendly, and has never seemed irritated or overwhelmed.  There is a large patio out front that you can drink on that has misters and heat lamps (depends on the season).  This is the absolute perfect place to go have a blast with friends, or even come alone when you feel the need for a night out. Always friendly, attentive, and..... oops I forgot the rest because I always end up giggly and drunk. Sigh.
Overall i would recommend this place. Good for small groups and Sunday morning football.

Let me start out by saying the baked ziti is the best i have ever had, and my mother is a first generation Italian American :0).  Major kudos on that recipe!  The wait staff is extremely attractive and friendly!  The owners are outstanding guys, you can tell that with in the first 5 seconds of talking to them.  The environment gives vegas sports bars a run for their money with the amount of TV's in the joint.  You walk in and are consumed by every live sporting event.  (thats a dream come true)  I live in scottsdale and will drive up every sunday to watch NFL games at Santisi!  Best sports bar hands down!    Coors Light is my beer of choice and they have $2.75 16 oz aluminum pints and $10 buckets of 4!  GREAT DEAL!

We come here to watch the UFC because this place is very big and all the walls are filled with different sizes of TV from top to bottom floor. We order garlic cheese bread and that was very delicious, we also order a large Pizza that was OK. The only thing I didn't like is you only get just one refill on your cold drinks, but the good thing is the cups are pretty big so that was enough for me.  The waitress did the best she can because it was very busy.  We will be back in the future for the UFC fights and we drive from Tempe.

The WINGS made crispy or well done are my favorite in all of Arizona. The Athena dressing is amazing for salads. The grilled chicken breast and sautéed veggies are to die for. Also love the veggie basket. Chicken tenders are probably one of the best I've ever had. And the michelada beer is hands down my favorite in all of Arizona!!! I have to drink it with a straw so my lips don't go numb... so good! Love this place!!
Very good food and service. A great place to watch sports!

Okay - Here's the deal. My wife and I have been going here since it's inception. I mean when they had a little deli take out counter! We were regulars for a long time and I would bring my family, friends, out-of-towners, even my work crew (party of 10-12) here for annual end of the year parties.  Unfortunately, the place is a shell of it's former self and our last several visits have confirmed it even more.   Food is bland, bland, bland. No salt or pepper, nothing. Wait times for food - not a Friday or Saturday - are ridiculously long. Staff is okay but, not even close to the awesome crew they once had.  We used to love the meatballs (now, bland, mushy & small), sausage (no color, flavor, looked boiled), Mama's lasagna - was heaven - now just sad, dry, & lacks flavor. Pasta shows up with dried reheated sauce (looks nuked). Chicken fingers - breading still great but, no flavor, none - unless you dip ranch sure but, come on - you have to at least salt chix, it has no natural flavor! Fries were great yet, it's fries so?  Writing this review breaks my heart like when Michael found out it was Fredo! I don't know who is left here that cares (John, Debbi, Toni)? Maybe the place was just was so successful for so long, they have forgotten what got them to the top.  After or last visit, we have to turn our backs to ya! Santisi Brothers as we once knew it is long gone...nothing lasts forever I guess.

Excellent pizza, great wings and an extensive menu of sandwiches make this a great place to visit. Large selection of tap beers as well.  The ultimate sports bar with tons of tv's and just the right vibe.  My only issue is the service as the waitress who served us never followed up after meal was served.  I have read other reviews about service as well and I am surprised the owners have not yet improved upon this issue.
Had a good time, good food, and the music-bingo was fun as well.  Ashley Nicole was a standout server...timely and efficient. Mike and I like the spot. Plenty of tv screens.

I love santisis. Such an awesome place. Always come with friends for the amazing Stromboli. Takes awhile to cook because it's made fresh. Such a good local bar. Idk what this Tatiana chick is talking about.. I've had Marcela as a server before and she's been great. I used to be a server and I know what good service is and that's what I get here. Usually at a bar it's a hit or miss, but santisis knows what's going on! Great food, awesome drinks and great service. Now that I live down the road I'll be coming here more often!! Gotta get my Stromboli fix! Good job santisis!

Driving home from the far northwest valley, I spotted the sign for Santisi Brothers from the freeway and told my husband what awesome pizza and oysters they had.   I guess I should mention the last time I was at Santisi Brothers was about 9 years ago. Back then, they did have great raw oysters--huge and succulent. I don't know when they stopped serving them but I was very disappointed tonight because that's what I really wanted.   I remembered the pizza as being right up there with some I've had back east. What we had tonight (the 10" cheese pizza--which by the way is the best test of how good a pizza is if it can stand alone with no toppings) was only a step above Domino's to me. Maybe the thin crust is better but I didn't feel like spending an extra $4.00 to find out.   The one bright spot was the Philly Cheese steak. They got the steak, cheese and peppers just right. The roll was a little doughy to me but I have high expectations for a cheese steak since I grew up outside of Philly.   The service was good and if you are a sports fan, you can't ask for more games on more TVs. I could have done without the screaming Oklahoma fans a couple of tables away though. But it's a sports bar so I don't hold them accountable for the fans there.   Santisi Brothers, if you read this, I am begging you to bring back the oysters. Maybe then the drive from the east side would be worth it. Otherwise I can find so-so bar food in my neck of the woods.

Santisis has been around forever and a day.  I've been here numerous times over the years.  The service has always been good and the place has a shit ton of tvs.  There's nothing to compete with this place in the near vicinity so if you are looking for a sports bar and are in the area this is your best bet.  The beer menu is average.  You got all your garbage domestics then a couple rotating local breweries and a rotating IPA.  If you are a real craft fan it's not really the best selection on tap or in bottles or cans.  The food is okay.  The wings are tasty but tiny.  The pizzas are average and the subs are probably the best of the items off the menu I have had.  The value of Santisi's happy hour specials is abysmal.  There are only a few items and it changes depending on the day you come in.  Come in on a Friday and you can get a buck off some fried zucchini.  Gee thanks!  You can usually find a toddler or three running around the bar.  Who takes their 3 year old to a sports bar?  Get drunk at the trailer park mom and dad.  Adults are trying to enjoy a beer and a game here.  There is also a patio out front in the sun with the misters facing the sidewalk instead of the patrons so if your dumb ass still smokes and it's summertime prepare to fry.
Great place. Visiting my brother and meeting the locals made this place a must visit.  Service is top notch.  I felt like family going here. Keep an eye on Ken Not Yee for me. Thanks

I had posted a review last night out of frustration that my service wasn't so good but I will say that John one of the owners called me today and took care of the situation.  I really appreciated that.  Just because the service was bad I won't knock the entire establishment.   Thanks John!  We will be back.

We love coming here and having karissa and lack serve us on saturdays. Delani and Debbie are fantastic too. All of these girls make the experience for us at sant is brothers. They are attentive and make sure that we have a great experience
I've been here far too many times. Good food, decent service and the prices are fair. Great place to watch any sporting event with the dozens of tv's all over the place.

If you want an atmosphere of TV-drenched and jersey wearing monotony this is your place. This is NOT my place.   As usual, they make up for the lack of decor and intimacy with very competitive drink specials and food items. Their service very personal 5*****stars for that!  The only thing special about this place is I am sure you can watch every channel listed on your Direct TV "guide" in one place. Seriously... why soooooo many TV's?  Do they get an influx of patrons during prime sporting events? Are they trying to compete with Best Buy in the TV department? oh well, everybody needs a niche.  NOte: Be careful of the random drunk guy trying to slide his chair to your table.      R\_

Great sports bar, they have pool tables & darts as well.  They must have about 100 TV's in the place and they get extremely busy during football sundays, ncaa tourney, etc.  Great food and the prices are very reasonable.  Please note, the place is dark inside, not a single window, just an fyi.
Best sports bar in town bar none.  Great food.  Golden Tee.  Dozens of TVs.  No reason to watch a game anywhere else.

This place is awesome! Tons of tvs, drink specials and food specials daily, great place for big groups, small groups, smoking, darts, pool, poker tournaments. You name it! This bar has it all! If I were to own a bar it would be very similar to this place!  The food.... is outrageous! Portions are huge, food is GREAT! Even just a basic Caesar salad is delicious. If you get anything with fries be prepared for a mountain of them! The chicken tenders are out of this world! A must try! With honey mustard and ranch! This place also kills Italian dinner! Fettuccini Alfredo is out of this world. Don't let the prices intimidate you. Just about everything is sharable!

The meatballs are a new favorite at this sports bar. You can get them on sliders, a hero or as I did with pasta. The dinner was about $15 and includes salad with a good blue cheese, garlic knots and choice of pasta. The angel hair is always one of my go to pastas. They load the sauce on and it does contain some garlic, but a good marinara. Manja!.
Good food. Screens everywhere. Service is hit or miss... TIP: The bread knots are ah-mazing! You can order a half order that is PLENTY for two people.

First let me say this is another case where I wish Yelp had a half star option.  If this were the case I would be placing this at 3.5.  I discovered online that this sports bar held a free poker league with potential entries to the WSOP.  Since there would also be playoff football I was sold and ready to make the journey.  Location:  I did not include this in my star rating, but the bar is located next to a discount movie theater in hat seems to be a run down strip mall.  Cool with me, but I could see some being taken aback.  Ambiance:  The inside was a little divey.  You can tell the place has been around for a while.  There was a noticeable smell.  As you got use to the place it disappeared but it was like a stale beer smell.  There are tons of TVs.  I can see where some would experience sensory overload.  Probably be better with less TVs that were a bit larger.  If you are a poker player they did have little poker tables which was cool.  Also all the fun bar games could be found pool, dart, etc...   Food:  There is a huge selection of offerings.  I did a sampler mix.  The mozzarella sticks and garlic bread where fine.  I'd say it is in the average range for bar food.  I definitely would want to try the pizza next time I go back.  Service:  There is a lot of staff.   All were friendly to me.  I was able to tell at times there was confusion with other patrons.  Let me say though this place was packed.  This was the busiest I have seen a sports bar since I've moved here.    Price:  For me this was maybe one of the biggest negatives.  When I compare what I had to quite a few other local establishments it was pricey.  I'd say each time was about one to two more (beers and bar apps) then what I would have hoped to pay. I'm by no means a tightwad, but since the ambiance is not amazing it was not as if I was paying for the experience.  Overall:  I went on an insanely busy day so I also dealt with a wide range of patrons.  The crowd in parts was rough which may have jaded my experience a bit.  I think I'd sit out on the patio next time.  I do plan on going back for poker and to try something different.   It was an okay experience but I've had quite a bit better.

I have to start by saying I LOVE THIS PLACE.  However, last night was super disappointing.  Food was good overall with the exception of the BREAD TIE IN MY SALAD.  Our server made the manager aware however she never came over to address it but did take a whole $3 off the bill.  Not kidding.  Really, you're cool serving a bread tie IN a salad but can't come acknowledge it?   I also specifically asked for a cup with a lid for my 5yo, at least 2x, however the server still brought him a huge cup, ignored my third request for a lid again AFTER she brought the drink to the table.  Well, the drink, of course, ended up in his lap, plate of food, and all over my Michael Kors purse.  So that was super too.  Bad night Santisi.  Not your norm at all.  :(
kelli is the best server here. she so helpfull and nice,! best server iv ever had by far. i will ask for her next time i come in! you rock kelli!!!!!!

Let me just start by saing the food is good, not great but good. But why I love this place is cause of the TV's and the atmosphere! I mean I can go and watch anything from football to bikini contests from soccer to water polo all at once!! They have so many tv's.

I joined my sister for a few drinks and food here a few nights ago. The food was great and the service was even better. A sweet little thing named Cara was our server. We kept her busy but she had a great attitude! Will be back again when we are on that side of town!

My boyfriend and I come here ALL the time. The food is great and the service is AMAZING. We usually like to eat pretty healthy so we get the grilled chicken and sautéed veggies- SO good. The chicken is always cooked perfect, never dry, and the veggies get a nice char on them. Sometimes if we feel like splurging we'll get a pizza and wings. We've never had a bad experience here- Erica's always our server. She's so friendly, always happy with a great attitude, and remembers our orders. I bartended for 7 years at a local neighborhood sports bar and I know the importance/ appreciation when you remember your regulars' orders. It's always a great place to watch sports, even tho I keep seeing complaints about the "small TV's" around the larger ones are 32"... lets be honest- how far away are you sitting? The furthest table from the small TVs are prob 12' away. Best sports bar in Phoenix, I'd say:)
Can't ever go wrong when selecting a sports bar, great food, organized, and great staff members. The pizza is great and the wings are always on point. Pick one of the hundreds of T.Vs to watch

I love this place. There are tvs everywhere so you can watch whatever game you want. The food is pretty good. Their buffalo chicken pizza is my fave from them. I love the amount of options they give you for draft. I love coming here to watch the games.

Best sports bar in the valley. Hundreds of tvs and really good food. The best wings anywhere. The staff is very attentive and remember you!! They have something for everyone here. Just a great place to stuff your face drink beers and watch sports.

Totally awesome atmosphere, been going for years. I remember when it was just a small pizzeria! Love the family, the staff and really love the meatballs! Televisions all over. Best place in town to watch a sporting event. Good prices, but the atmosphere is over the top. Play some darts. Eat great food. Great place!

Used to come out here all the way from Goodyear to meet up with friends. I've had a lot of drunken nights here...so much I took a little break from it all :) It's your typical sports bar. Tons of TVs, $5 Large Drafts, Pool Tables and what not.   Friday/Saturday night don't expect the huge party scene...It mellow just how i like it. No nasty guys grabbing my ass or a line across the room just to use the loo. The very reason why Ii went there for my birthday.  I took one star off just because it took a little long to get orders in for drinks and food, but not gonna b*^ch about it. PS suicide wings are delish...and so are the fried zuccinni.

To be honest the pizza that I had was so so. The garlic parmesan french fries were amazing! The bar slash restaurant itself had a very cool atmosphere to it. They must have over 50 TVs play on all sorts of sports. Overall it was decent.

This place has to be what Buffalo Wild Wings was like in the 1990's.  I've never seen so many CRT TV's in one spot in my entire life!  I recently stopped by to watch the Suns successfully spank the despised Spurs in the first game of the playoffs, so that alone may add a star to this review.  Once you get past the fact the initial shock of how many TV's there are, the beauty of this place really sets in.  Each Table along the edge has it's own old-school big screen that as mentioned, is 98% likely to be tuned into sports - awesome!  25 oz beers were under $4 and really hit the spot - word to the wise though, don't order a 12 oz right afterwards because when you put the two next to each other, the 12 ozer will make you look super wimpy.  Food was great too - the pizza was some of the best I've had in a bar, and really revived my appreciation for the classic beer/pizza combo!  All in all - great place to catch a game (any game!) and some beer with food that goes good with beer!
best sports bar in town!! Love the staff and the food is the best!!! If you haven't tried this place you are missing out!!

The food ad service is great.  The kitchen does an incredible job with all the food.  The menu is vast and all sauces and food is made onsite.    Try the grilled zucchini aa a side it is very tasty.     This place is big, but they get it done.   If you want a quiet atmosphere sit on their patio.    I really like this place.
Most of the time we like being here. The chicken strips are great. However, the service has been getting bad. The wait staff is lazy and never asks if we need anything.
I love Santisis.. great place to enjoy a beer. My wife really loved it when kaci is working. She's awesome.. we always have a great time when she's bartending... kaci is the shit...love you
To greasy for me but its pretty dang good.  My bf loves this place, it can get very packed and unpleasant. Cool sports joint and awesome nights for kareoke

Stopped in here for a bite and some libations after a crappy action movie at the cheap theater next door. Definitely a sports bar - TVs everywhere - a bit overwhelming at first. The server was adorable. And an idiot. But that's okay. Sports bars value hot over competent. I know this, I can accept it. When I order "Makers. Rocks, splash coke with a water back" at a BAR, I shouldn't get a deer in the headlights look. She wrote it down word for word - then I had to ask again later for the water. That said - the food was better than I expected - and I'll admit the menu was more extensive than I would have guessed walking in. We shared the Italian nachos, a couple sliders, and other various fried things (sorry - I was on mental vacation that night, and the Maker's Mark was doing what it is paid to do!)  I don't think I'd ever come out of my way to make Santisi Brothers a destination. But for a night of cheap movies and a bite to eat with cocktails - I don't think I'd say no!
Really fun place. Food is good and service is good. It's a guarantee that you'll be watching something you like with all the TVs available

GREAT place to catch the game...well any game really. It felt like there were 3001 TVs in there all playing something sporting related.  The beer selection was good and the food was better than most sports bars I have been to.  When hockey season starts, this very well might be my pick to watch the Blackhawks have another AMAZING season! :)

UGH! Really want to rate this place higher but after this weekend I just can't do it. Sitting in front of a TV, waaaay before the game starts, decked out in our team's gear head-to-toe, the d*ck manager walks in front of us and changes the channel so that the TV we're watching is on the SAME channel that 14 other TVs are programmed to and he was so kind as to move our game to one of the teeny tiny TVs. We asked if he could please change it back - he literally looked at us and said 'No - you can move though.'  Maybe he doesn't like a bunch of women sucking down brewskis watching football? Too much sexiness for his bar? LOL   His loss, and Santisi's too ...   Other than that - the wings are good, beer is cold, and patio is fun.

Service was pretty good. The food we got was very good, flavorful and large portion sizes. Wings were don't perfectly.  Downfall, I asked for a couple craft beers they had on their menu but we're completely out of them.

I have visited this establishment 3 times and each time I have been disappointed with the service. Great wings and decent drinks but the wait staff is HORRIBLE ! Yesterday I went to Santisi's for Sunday afternoon football, wings and beer, after waiting 5 minutes with no service, I got up and asked the bartender if my table could get some service. I was told someone would be right over. Another 10 minutes went by and still no service, again I asked if my table could get some service, and once more I was told someone would be right over. After about another 5 minutes we got up and left and went to an establishment that acknowledged our presence and provided service. Sad thing is Santisi's wasn't that busy !

So we started out having fun for a good friends birthday. Ate, drank, sang .... Until at 9:00pm we were told we were too loud and must leave. No pre warning. No nice letting us know we may have been disturbing "hockey" while we were singing.  No, we were not obnoxious. No we were not mean... Just hanging with friends on our way home from the D Backs game . I drove 300 miles to get here and was kicked out for singing too loud.! I own a business myself and will never recommend this place again. Really the only thing good was Norma our waitress who tried to help us. She new we were just a happy small group having fun!! Will not be back
