I've only ever been during NFL football Sundays and it's PACKED!! Which is fun but make sure you get there between 9:15-9:30 to guarantee yourself a table where you can actually see your game!  They do have a TON of TVs, although some are 13" so you better sit close ;)  They have a breakfast buffet between 9 - 11 am until their kitchen opens.  The food isn't great but it gets you through the day.  Some good beer specials, which is rare on game day.
Great place to watch sports, not a bad seat in the house. Food was great-loved the meatballs and sauce! Service was terrific too! We will be back!

This place is everything a sports bar should be. Lots and lots of TV's...for one. I love being able to watch 4 different sports and play trivia all at the same time.  The drink specials are pretty decent. They're not a dollar or anything, but the big beers are cheap on happy hour.  The food is great! So far I've only tried the spinach dip, wings and their all-you-can-eat fish & chips. All of them were seriously delicious! These types of food are pretty standard in sports bars but I've definitely had my fair share of unfortunate food items from other places. These certainly surpassed my expectations.  And last but not least, their star of the show, Debbie. One of the best bartenders I've ever seen. She runs that bar like a champ, knows nearly every face that walks through that door, and pours great drinks. And by great, I mean a good stiff drink that's not so strong that you can't taste anything else in it.  We frequent this place quite often, and for good reason. Do yourself a favor and stop in!

My friends and I enjoy going here on Sundays for football.  Of course, I live the closest and have to be the first one there to get us a good table by the right tv's.  Food is really good, over 100 tv's, and battle for sound (so just because the Cardinals play during your team's game, doesn't mean that they will get the sound.  Bears' sound has won every time).  I'm not crazy about the service.  Sometimes we don't see our server for a really long time and no matter who we have, they almost never smile.  I know this isn't the most glamorous job, but "fake it til you make it".  At least pretend you want to be there.  Other than that, we love the atmosphere, some of the fans get too carried away, but that's okay.  It's pretty funny.    It's nice that they give you a layout of where all the games are going to be, so you know when you walk in, what table to get.  I like to get there at least an hour before the first game, so I have my pick of spots, plus if you land a table that has chairs with backs on them, you're golden.

I am a fan of this place. You always know what you are going to get. Good food, cold beer at a decent price and a great view of a TV. We watched all the Coyotes playoff games here and had no complaints. Not sure I would go here if not to watch a game, but when there is something we want to watch, this place is the best!

Let me start off by stating I am extremely picky when it comes to Italian food.  Lucky for them I didn't actually see any on their menu.  Sure it had names that could fool one into thinking they served some Italian style dishes what was brought to our table proved that to be a false belief.    If you're looking for a place to have a drink while sitting in each others laps then this is the place for you.
Love this place! Drinks are big and strong, TV's everywhere and food is great and a good price! Try the mussels or meatball sandwich, pizza and garlic knots are also recommended!!!

Until recently, I would have rated Santisi's 5 stars.  A ton of tv's, karaoke two nights a week and a HUGE bar.  Darts, pool, video games and music.  Good food... excellent pizza and wings, excellent appetizers and drinks.  Very entertaining.  Except for the meat market part.  Really not Santisi's issue, but it really is an issue.  I've almost gotten into like 3 fights because men are such assholes there.  The girls just ignore each other, which is fine with me.  I also am under the impression someone slipped something into my drink one night and I got damn lucky I left an hour after that drink at 830pm on a friday. (or so I was told by my friends I was with... I truly do not remember and I definitely did not have too much to drink... I am the first one to admit something like that.)  It could have been a lot worse for me from that place and I have refused to go back since.
We have eaten here twice. Both times hamburgers. They were very good. Service was very good. Atmosphere was very noisy.

I just had Wings and White Pizza and both were the best I've ever tasted.  The atmosphere is fun, and even though it's crowded, my server named Michelle had it all under control. Great food, great service. Highly recommended
Great pizza.  Reasonably priced.  It changed my life.  Fun atmosphere, every wall is covered in TVs, expect it to be busy during sporting events!
Good food, good service and awesome atmosphere! Love watching football games here with friends.

One of the top 10 sports bars in Phoenix,  and the food is great. Good place to go to catch a sporting event, enough tvs to please any sports fanatic. The food is top notch. Have had one of everything on the menu over the years and have yet to get a bad meal.   The beers come in a gigantic, iced mug.   Be ready to wait for a seat if it's footbal season, place can get very crowded.
This place is every mans dream because it's a total sports bar with hundreds of tvs and great food good looking people.  They even have crab days..

Love santisi brothers ! I grew up right around the corner from this place and have been coming here for years. Tons of tvs so great for games, good service, and awesome food. They have darts and pool tables which are in great condition. I would say the only downside is during the week they don't have a server that comes to the dart tables or pool tables so you have to go to the bar to get your drinks which can be a little annoying when it's busy. Other than that I love this place !

Great happy hour prices! The food portions are large and cheap during happy hour! Their regular menu is extensive and there's a lot to choose from. I was expecting more people to be there for Monday happy hour but it was not packed at all! Must try the Giovanni sauce!

We come here about once a month, and despite it's dive strip-mall appearance, it's one of the coolest sports bars on the west side.  The pros: Lots of stuff to do inside, and the bar is bigger than it looks.  Plenty of televisions, and the beer is priced right.  Food is well above average for a bar.  Like, really good.  Pizza is one of the best in town.  Service on the inside is good, but a word of caution for those who like to sit on the patio... we have waited up to 25 minutes to be acknowledged out there.  So patio service is hit or miss (get a drink at the bar inside and tell the bartender to send a server outside).  If you want to combine happy hour with another good value, check out the $3 movie theater next door!
The best sausage and peppers sandwich I've had...period...also, our bartender Nanci is one of the best around. Thanks for a great Sunday Funday!!!

Went there a few nights ago , food was AMAZING ! My server was EXCELLENT I believe her name was Cara ! Made sure drinks were filled and checked on us at the right times ! Definitely will be going back !!!

Hey Santisi Family & team. I am slow to update, but I just had to fill you in.  A few weeks ago I came in with my 2 nieces. It was quite early & I think it was a Tuesday. There was only a hand full of people at the bar. The bartender was extremely curtious & very patient as my kids wanted to run around & play video games and not tell us what they wanted to eat. Anyways, I ordered 2 orders of chicken strips & fries, a salad & sprites to share between us. First off, you have, by far, the very BEST tasting chicken strips I have ever tasted. Not kidding guys! The chicken was really juicy and the breading is very tasty & perfectly crispy.  I don't think they are the same as I used to get, but either way....whatever you are doing differently...keep doing it!  We absolutely Loved them! And, WOW... the portions were HUGE! We couldn't even finish one order of them.  Now, your Ranch dressing is so delicious that the girls only want it from "'Tisi's" & they want to eat it on everything! Lol.  Your BBQ sauce is great & mixed with the ranch dressing was quite yummy... Folks you have gotta try them together on a salad. I swear it was soooo good.  But, the Giovanni sauce is just so damn amazing that it can be poured on anything & everything! I eat it on my salad, wings, ribs, chicken breast dinner, even dip my pizza crust in it. You name it.... It's incredible!  So, can't you bottle this stuff?
Love their wings! Great service. One of my favorite sports bars in the Valley.

Great food and a great place to watch multiple sporting events.   Calamari is consistently good, get the medium sauce, delicious!! Lemon pepper wings were spot on.   I've come here with the family also and never been disappointed.  Great place for dinner. Friendly and accommodating  staff just tops off a great night.

This is my favorite sports bar and grill in the valley!  The food is so incredibly good.  I have never ordered something that I didn't like.  Some of my favorites are there soups like the creamy chicken noodle and the southwestern chicken.  The service is top notch.  The wait staff is  prompt and accommodating.   This is the best place in town for sports events with huge screens everywhere.  I also have to mention that the white pizza and the giovanni pizza are amazing!  The giovanni sauce is a specialty and it is delicious on, not only this pizza, but the chicken and pork chops they serve as well.  It is the perfect blend of sweet and spicy!

Great sports bar! Tons of TV's on every wall, pool tables, darts, etc.  The waitresses and bartenders are all very attentive and checking to make sure your glass is full.  The food was pretty good too.  Great pizza and the wings were tasty!  We travel to Glendale frequently for sports events and to visit family.  We will definitely be back.

Great wings. Delicious potato skins. $2.75 large drafts Sun-Wed from 10PM to close.  The best part about Santisi is the food and drafts.  They have friendly and cute servers and one sexy one.  Nonetheless, getting your first order can take awhile their customer service can be real slow at times.  The only negative is that their kitchen closes at 11PM except for Thursday - Saturday which is midnight.  Great food. Nice drafts. Friendly, cute and sometimes sexy female servers ?  Yay, I am a fan!

Just ate here for the fourth time in last four months...not impressed...we live in Idaho. We have had to make several trips here since October and have made it a point to eat here each trip. Twice this trip. This is a lot more than pizza/sports pub. All the food is really good. The Clams Bianco(hope that is right) is to die for. Best clams we have ever had. Wings are as good or better than any I have had any where(recommend lemon pepper). Oh and by the way their Pizza is fantastic as well.  Service is top notch. Jessi, Tanya and Nanci were so nice and gave us great service even though they are always busy. Feel horrible we forgot our fourth servers name, we think her name was Alex. She was fantastic as well. The big cold mugs of beer round out your experience! For you none beer drinkers they have some fun drinks. Can't wait for next trip to Phoenix!

I love wings, absolutely love them... and you can tell how much i love them by my pictures... anyways, Santisi has awesome wings..  The atmosphere can be a bit creepy at times and pretty dark, they have ton of TV's all tuned towards some sort of sport or game. Usually there is a lot of seating unless their is some sort of big game going on or its Friday night.   The food there is awesome.. Great/awesome wings, the ribs there rock, the pizza is awesome too. The beer prices are good, and i reasonable. The waitresses are mostly hot, and really nice. Out of the 20+ times I've only had one "interesting experience" there (and no it didn't involve little people).  I would definitely recommend this place.  One note. Although it's a kid friendly bar, i wouldn't recommend bringing your kid there.

Tonight was in unfortunate night. My son who served in the US Navy tried to play a game of pool. The table he tried to  play at was occupied by someone who didn't understand the rules of pool. My son went to get more change for the table which I'm sure is on their video...  he came back and his quarter was moved off the spot he had placed it. When my son said I play winner the other guy said no I'm playing with my girl and my son told him the rules are next game I play winner. The other guy said no and my son said no that's not how the game is played I put my money down I play winner. The other hey says no I'm with my girl you can suck my di@!  Yes my son got angry. Yes he said some bad things back but Jonny the manager who eventually came said to us just play at another table and let the guy and his girlfriend stay at their table. He did tell them my son was right and those are the rules of the game but that was it. We left and I later called to apologise for my son cursing but said I didn't feel what he did was fair. The man who was rude and insulting got to stay at his table but my son was told go play at another table. I didn't think it was fair and I told Jonny so. He said I've been working here 10 years and was doing my job. That's how we keep the piece and he started raising his voice at me when I said I didn't think it was fair or right to keep the couple at the table. I love this place. We go there often but I think he handled the situation unfairly and was rude to me and should not have raised his voice when all I said was I didn't think the situation was handled fairly. For someone with 10 years experience I'm sad to say he was rude and unprofessional and I just wanted to share that in case you ever experience something similar. Sorry Jonny you could have handled it better and you certainly didn't need to be rude to me.

This is the best pizza I have had in Phoenix! Nothing is better, it is worth the drive and I live far. Huge sports bar with TVs all over, you will never miss a thing in this sports bar. I have come here for years, lots of great memories and the pizza has been consistently amazing. Coke products here!! Just writing this review is making me crave this pizza. Reasonable prices and tons of room for everyone. Can't wait to go back again!

The wait staff here is very friendly, however, slow to get service... they may just be under staffed. We ordered wings here on "wing night" and it took 40 minutes to get them to the table - so long we ended up having to get them to go since we ran out of time before our next event. We were with a group and the one strange thing that happened was that we wanted to order a sub but the waitress asked us for a credit card for a tab... a tab when ordering food? We told her we'd be paying cash and could we still order when we pay with cash? She seems frustrated but ultimately took our order - weird. Anyway, it's a big place but if you go here don't plan for quick service... take your time, play some darts or pool and chill. Oh yea, it smells a little strange in this place. You won't notice after a few minutes but when you first walk in you'll get a musty greasy smell, meh... it won't keep me from coming back.
Always have a good time when we go here, gets freakin' busy during Happy Hours! HUGE selection of TV's! sooo many you dont know what to watch!

This place is fun to go hang out and drink a couple. Has a wide selection of beers on draft and bottle. Food is awesome. Last time had pizza and wings and was really good. Friday night is fish fry that is awesome. It's all you can eat and they fish is big chunks and not greasy at all. Also had the pork chops , big and not dried.  This place is fun for family's or a night on the town. Tons of tvs to watch any sports you want.
I've been coming here since I moved here in 2001. I've watched them expand and grow, but their food and service has always remained Top Notch. I will continue to come here as long as they are around.

First of all, I love this place. It never let's me down. All the Employees are so customer friendly, And the service is so personable.   I am a Professional and work long hours, and when I come here I am completely relaxed and taken care of. The Food is always top notch and so very good.  These guys do it right. Oh, by the way, the 100+ TV ' S don't hurt either.  Debbie, Delayne, Ashley are the Best Bartenders around. Tell them your drink of choice, and your name, i promise they will remember Highly-rated and recommend this place to Everyone.

Santisi Brother's has awesome pizza and the best calzone I have ever had. I can't eat them anywhere else and I crave one about once a week.  There are tons of tv's covering the walls in the main dining room so if you love sports and enjoy watching several games at once this place is for you. The only problem I have here is that the waitresses give better service if you are a guy or with a guy. Ayesha is right though there are always cute boys here! One offered to buy me a sea monster shot and I fell in love. Aaaah!
I've only been here for the Friday $10.99 all you can eat pizza and wing buffet... And it was amazing! Love it!! Definitely will be back.

Our favorite neighborhood bar and goto spot for friday fish fry. Kate is fantastic and always takes great care of us. With this being a sports bar, it can definitely get busy but the food is always on point, fresh, and the coldest beer in town.

It was my first time going, had a great time. It was a Friday night and they had us playing song bingo. I ordered the classic New York style pepperoni pizza with some hot wings. The food was really good. Great customer service, definitely going back next time I'm in the area.

It's a sports bar, so it's loud, a zillion tvs, and a little dark. However, the food was that of restaurant quality. Had a meatball and tomato pizza with medium wings. Pizza was fresh, crispy crust, and the meatballs were yum! The wings were crispy and tasted like fresh chicken. Could've used a little more sauce, but I'm not complaining. I will definitely be going back for the delicious food.

Customers BEWARE.  This place will scam you out of your money when paying your bill. Visited this establishment for the first time, the bill was $40 and change and provided a $100 cash for the bill. Received $42 and change back. Where was the other $16? Gratuity was not added on the bill for them to snag the remaining MISSING change.  Just a heads up to patrons... I have the impression this is NOT the first time they have done this! I will NEVER return.  Awful experience.

I've been here about 3 times over the past couple of years.  I've been there when it's pretty crowded and mildly so.  It's a great place to meet before a high school football game on a Friday early evening.  It's exciting and electric with lots of sports athletic spectator energy.  The menu is varied and large with a seemingly endless selections of expected sports bar items all with an Italian flair.  I've only sampled their pizza, meatballs and a Cesar salad but it's all been quite good and delicious.  From what I've been told, this is a family operated establishment that still uses some of grandma's old world recipes and it tastes like it.  Good stuff.   They of course also have a wide variety of beers on tap and in the bottle along with a full bar.  The service is always friendly and efficient even when it's pretty crowded.  If you don't like televised sports and sports themed diners, then this place is NOT for you.  There are TVs everywhere broadcasting a variety of professional and collegiate competitions from mainstream to off the beaten path.  But, if you love an authentic sports bar with lots of energy and great food/drinks, then don't miss Santisi Brothers.

My Bro and I dropped into this bro spot (Santisi Bros) today for lunch. I've been here many times as it is right down the road from my neighborhood.  It's dark inside, so prepared to be blinded if you exit mid-day. TONS of TV's lining the walls, most tuned in to a sporting event. Good beer & drink selection and good food selection. Pizzas, pastas, salads, calzones, sandwiches and more.  Today I went with the eggplant parmesan sub and I really think it is the best damn one I have ever had. So damn tasty and perfect. Crisp bread with a soft inside, crispy eggplant slices, delish cheese. I don't think it can get any better. There pasta dishes are also HUGE, so be prepared. Santisi is a great neighborhood sports bar who happens to also make some damn good food. Recommended.

Best sports bar in town the food was fabulous and we love our waitress Ciara. She rocks.... we needed a place to watch the Vikings game. I gts viking bars and we ended up here. We will be back again and again. Thank you all for the great Service

I'm from New SoCal and miss my family, food and cards. After being in Phoenix for 2 days, I found Santisi's by accident  when I stopped in for a quick lunch. The food, service and atmosphere were great so I kept coming back to practice my pool shots as I dined on Bruschetta and other Italian-fare. Then I found Santisi's hosted a Texas HoldEm Poker league.... this was even better, I missed playing cards with my friends and family. What really sealed the deal was eating my first Zeppole; a fried Italian donut that looks and tastes like a beignet from Cafe du Monde in the French Quarter. What more can I say? This is like home, away from home.

Busy and packed, you need to plan to get a decent seat here.  They sell more than the basics of beer, and the food is great.  I admit, I come here because of the friendly employees and the great beer.  It's not a chain style bar/Italian which makes it awesome in my book.  I don't talk to people and yet I can have a conversation with the bartenders here.  That's saying something.

Best sports bar I've ever been to.   And so lucky it is close to me.  I need to go more.    They have a variety of foods and so many Televisions,   You will be able to catch your game,  no matter where you sit.      I would say their Pepperoni pizza,   Mild or giovanni's BBQ wings,  and Italian nachos are the best.      Would definitely recommend for anyone.   I see families in there all the time.   Maybe not football Sundays for young children, just because of loudness.   And they also care about their customers.   Servers are always good,  and during football season they give away a bunch of free gift cards.

This place is pretty awesome. You usually don't expect much on the taste side from a sports bar, but everything we had was very good. Our waitress was very friendly and sweet. Put up with about 20 of us hooligans! She was also ridiculously hot (freckles). She gave us a couple of places to go out that night, and even split ALL of our checks, which I was later informed that they have an old school check out system. They are all paper and calculators, so it must have been such a hassle to do that, but she did it with a smile! Great place!

I have no idea where the great reviews come from. Maybe the employees. Cause what I saw and what I dealt with there is no way I would ever give this place a 4 or 5 star review. The servers seem to be lost and the other ones seem as friendly as a pest rattlesnake. I only had one drink cause it took forever for that one. Wasn't gonna see how long it would take for another one. The food didn't look good. Saw a party of 4 next to us get their food one at a time cause the waitress couldn't remember what they said to the time she got to the computer it was quite sad to watch and you could see the frustration on the tables face. I have no idea how this place has been in business this long with the waitstaff they have. Oh maybe that's why the turn over is so high. It might not be the staff but maybe management and owns that are the problem?  Never will spend another dime at this place again!!!

It's just not worth it to go here. The service is a hit or miss - some waitresses are helpful; some are bimbos. The food isn't that great... you can definitely find better. The inside setup... well, we had to sit outside because of it. I wouldn't go back.

Great place for night life! If your single and looking to mingle you need to stop by here! I tried the chicken tenders off their menu and I am very impressed!! Probably the best chicken tenders I have ever had!

Have been here to eat plenty of times and the food never disappoints. Everything I get on the menu I enjoy. They serve big draft beers which I enjoy. Service can be slow at times but for the most part the servers have positive attitudes. One of my favorite restaurants because the food is always tasty!

I think my first visit to Santisi was in 1998, when it occupied the far south portion of the current space. It was a long, narrow shop run by two brothers that had relocated here from NYC. My friends and I would head over for lunch a couple of times a week because there was noone else ever there and it was the best NY style pizza anywhere near the office. The slices were huge, the cheese was just right, and the prices were cheap.  Well I guess we didn't really need to worry about them staying in business because it's 10 years later they have built one of the most amazing sports bars in the entire Phoenix area.  After acquiring the storefronts adjacent to them, they now have a spaceous location. If you like sports, and I mean any kind of sports, this is the place to head to for a group watch. They have over 60 screens throughout and if you don't see the match up that you are looking for, simply head over to the bar or alert your waiter/waitress and it will soon be up somewhere in the room. A couple of hints: 1) if you are going on a big game day, get there early - this place starts to actually rock with all the energy produced, and 2) if you are showing up with a big group, call ahead and reserve some tables - otherwise you may find yourself spread all over the bar.  The menu has grown substantially and now inlcudes several seafood options in addition to the standard pizza, pasta, and calzone offerings. When I visit, I usually get an order of wings (seriously the best in Phoenix) and a Mushroom and Cheese pie (because it's pretty close to one that I was addicted to in Manhattan), fold the peice up sammie style and let the grease drip down - YUMMO. Actually the only thing that I've ever had that wasn't pretty decent were the zeppelies. They are supposed to be delicate little fried, airy peices of dough dusted with powdered sugar, but these chew more like peices of bazooka.  They have a buffet at lunch, a dirt cheap HH, Poker tournies, trivia, a full service bar, reasonable prices on most of their food, and ummm have you ever seen 60 screens outside of Frys Electronics?!!  And for those of you interested in the softer sex, they have the Santisi version of Hooters girls, called.... you guessed it - Santisi Girls.  I have a feeling that if Tony and his gang would have looked for an alternative to the BadaBing, they might have opted for someplace just like this!
Over priced and overated. They don't offer the level of service they used to here. The food is below what it used to be.

I went here for my friend's birthday last night and the only word I have to describe the experience is... Weird. I think there may have been only 10 girls in the place even though it was pretty busy in the pool table room, so definitely what my understanding of a "sausage fest" is.   The beer prices were okay, 3.50 for a pretty large mug of either Miller, Bud, or Ultra. I didn't eat, we just drank beer and fought for time on one of the two pool tables.   Overall, I think it was just not as cool as I was hoping for, and the crowd was a little shadier than I would have liked. The waitress was pretty surly, but I'm a server too and I think I would be just as off-putting if I dealt with that crowd on a daily basis.  I hear the pizza's pretty good so I may return during the day to try it, but I probably won't go again on a Saturday night.

It has been years since I was here.  Went today with some co-workers to celebrate.  Nice big spot that has 2 bars, 3 pool tables and tons of Tv's and Dart boards.    Waitress was pretty spot on with our slightly indecisive group of like 8.  I had the Chicken breast plate with fries.  The breast was obviously a frozen one but the cook and seasoning on it was good.  The seasoned fries are horrid.  I don't know what that seasoning is, but it's almost like parmesan cheese.  They were covered in it.  Overall it was not bad.  Good place for some happy hour.
I wasn't a huge fan of the food, but this is one of my favorite places to watch football. You can see any game you want at any location in the place.

If there is something on the television then this place will have it! There are tv's everywhere which is pretty awesome.  There is seating all over and a great place for groups of 15+ people.  There is a separate side for pool and darts where you have to be 21 which is nice.  They have good craft beer selections as well as awesome drink specials.  Their wings are so gwwooooood!  Holy buckets if you enjoy wings you need to try these!   Televisions all over for every type of game or event and great food and drink.  Not a bad place for the kids to enjoy a sports bar/restaurant.

Friday 10/1/10  Everything was great but we used an Entertainment Book discount and the waitress screwed it up 2 times. The 3rd time it was within a couple bucks of being correct and the family was ready to go.   Watch your bills a little closer.    Saturday 10/2/10...dont judge me.  We started here for the bday dinner and a drink or 3. Glad I used DD'd  The waitress was brand spanking new, but did a good job. At least the bill was correct.

Great food, great service, LOVE the atmosphere with all the televisions.  The ONLY negative I dock it for is that they could definitely have better specials...which costs them a star, but everything else is great and we will definitely be back.
I love this place!!!!fun poker 3 days a week!!great food!!!great prices!!!even better people!!!!

Santisi's is perfect. You can sit at the bar, sit at a table or booth- or sit on the patio with misters. There is food here - lots of excellent pizzas, and seafood! This place must have a crazy electric bill, so many big TVs everywhere. Beer is served in icy mugs mmmm The service is great and they pay attention to you.   UPDATE: watch your BILL! Mine has always run about 40/50 $ and one day I asked to split the bill. My 5.75 appetizer magically turned into a 9.75 appetizer because of the servers "handwriting". All this time we been paying it and givin high handy tips like mad. Now all of a sudden I realize they been doing all kinds of arbitrary math on me and my sister. Watch your bill and don't be ashamed to have it "itemeized". That shit is scandalous

Honestly the BEST pizza and wings in the valley! Have tried almost everything on the menu and love it all.  Great place to have a couple drinks and watch any and all sporting events as the walls are covered with TV's. Highly recommend Santisi!

This is hands down the best pizza we've had since we've been here... and the best we've had in awhile anywhere! Thin crust, NY-style, well-done - simply delicious. What would make it even better? Anchovies as a topping option! What's with not being able to find anchovies in Phoenix!!??!  For $25 we got a take out special including a 16" pizza and 24 of the most fresh and tasty wings. Each topping was +$2.50. Great value for an absolutely amazing meal. Get some anchovies and I'll find a way to give it a sixth star! :)

Hung out here for Happy hour with some of my cousins and a friend.  The food was DELICIOUS! Our first waitress was very nice and provided great service! We started off on the main side of the bar.  After eating we ventured to the room with the pool tables.  We flagged down a waitress by the name of Karissa to order.  Karissa was extremely rude the whole evening.  I am not sure if she was having an off night but she answered our questions with smart a*! answers, kept rolling her eyes and when my cousin asked her for a bacardi and diet tall with a lime she told him he could order it at the bar.(I was like Wow! Really?!) Unsure why she was so snippy with us. We only ordered a few rounds from her and were never rude in anyway to her.  We complained to the manager who our friend knew and he said he would make sure it was dealt with.  He must have talked to Karissa because after that she wouldn't serve us. The manager also told our friend our complaint was not the only one of the evening about her.  Another smiling friendly waitress replaced her.This waitress was super sweet.  I think this place is a lot of fun and seems like they typically have great service. Just beware if you get Karrissa as your server hopefully she will be in a better mood if she serves you. :/

Drove all the way from the East side of town. BEST sports bar I've ever been to. TONS OF TV'S great food, we had breakfast sandwich, wings & strombolis all were great. Owner has put a lot of TLC into the menu... wide variety of food types w generous portions. I highly recommend check it out sometime.

Went here for my birthday on Friday.  We got the santisi combo and 24 wings.  I havent been here in years and the food is still good.  The wings were cooked well...crispy and not swimming in sauce.  The pizza is decent.  All in all I would eat here again.

So stopped by because we were about to watch a movie next door and started off waiting for someone to say oh you have to tell us your sitting outside before someone checks on you then after ordering drinks and food they delivered the garlic knots and asked if you wanted nothing I replied yes another round  after poking my head in and out of the door still no service they delivered our pizza and asked again but left before we could respond. Poor customer service and losing revenue because staff just doesn't care. Will think twice about ever going black would recommend going across the way to TGIF

No stars is what in want to give. I came with a group of friends tonight and our server wanted to leave so we paid her and tipped. It tok 35 minutes for us to get another server after we asked at the bar and then the manager finally came over. And don't try to get a beer for your friends at the bar it's one at a time even if your group can be clearly seen by the bartender.
Great TVs good for sports. Good soup and pizza. Today I am trying the meatball pasta. I recommend this place for games.

Picture this:  Dad, w/my 2 /teen kids, looking to blow a Groupon on a Thursday night at a sports-bar themed place called Santisi Brothers.  Sounds easy enough, right?  Now, factor in Thursday Night Football (the kind where your cable bill is EXTRA to get these special Thursday night games so EVERYONE hits the sports bar/grill), and picture a tatt-loving, mostly smoking clientele, who flood the place and take all the available indoor seating.  So where does that put us?  ON THE PATIO...where smokers temporarily reside while leaving their reserved tables inside.  Nice way to show the kids a quality time, experience, take them to the smoking section...  So, kids, let's just sit outside here, watch the game on these nice HD big screens, kinda nice by ourselves...and the obnoxious cigarette smoke!  Clearly, I was in the wrong place at the wrong time (dad in bar w/kids during PM football)!   Yet, that being said, Santisi does a great job of making affordable beer drinking and eating good quality food while the layman gets his mid-week NFL fix.  The manager recognized how we stood out like a sore thumb (that is, a sore thumb enshrouded in cigarette smoke), and very graciously kept an eye on us and even provided complimentary desserts to my kids, who instantly became life-long fans of Santisi Bros!  The service (Alysia) was solid, punctual, and quite easy on the eyes, too! Pizza and Chef Salad were fresh, perfect temp's, and presented nicely.  I will definitely go back, but not with kids.  Nice staff as well, and they did their best to make the family feel welcome.

My girlfriend and I came by late one night for a quick drink.   This place was nearby in a strip mall and parking was abundant. It was pretty cold and late so I can figure why there wasn't many people here. Probably around a dozen and a half patrons plus staff.  We came in and the kitchen was closed sadly. However, they had a full bar and the bartender was pretty quick to attend. We got our drinks fast and never had to wait.   We grabbed a pool table and played a few games. The tables were clean and leveled correctly. The felt and sticks weren't used and abused.   There was a few guys that seemed kind of obnoxious but they were pretty drunk.   The cost of drinks were pretty inexpensive.   The place had A LOT of TVs. All flat panels. Most were mid sized but a few that lined a huge portion of a wall were decent sized...like 50" or above. They had a few posters up advertising for their hosted poker night.   There is a patio there for outside drinking and smoking. There's a few TVs out there as well.   Overall, pretty decent experience. Didn't put a dent in the wallet between two people drinking. I wouldn't mind coming back here during earlier hours to try some of their food. From the looks of it and reviews, the place has some pretty good food.

They're open until 12am on sundays. When i goy here around 1030pm they told me they closed the kitchen at 10pm. So no food unfortunately. But got my drink and had no issue with that. The music on the other hand had me LIT. We left for food but will definitely be coming back earlier to enjoy the full experience (food and drink and music).

Closed kitchen early because they were slow.  Manager "Johnny" is a loser. We had a groupon and he would not honor it.  Hate to say this but we would never try this place again even though we lost 17.50.
I'm a regular, I love it, and it loves me...  Can not go wrong with Santisi Brothers. It's usually packed, so get there early, and be sure to tip your waitresses!!

This food is so good.  I had the fried Zucchini and my hubby had the Italian sub with fries.  He says it was very good.  This place is live and plays excellent music.  It is a fun place to eat and drink with  your hubby and friends.  Love the food.  I enjoyed playing  roll & rock bingo.
Amazing service!!!!!!! Ordered calzone with pepperoni delicious !!!!!!!!!!! Lost count of the number of tv's every wall has a bank of tv's covering it!!

I I sat in there for like 20 minutes and couldn't get anybody to service me so I don't know what the hell you guys are talking about I will never go back to that dump again. They called the manager and she couldn't do a damn a damn thing. She told me she would have the bartender help me period while real customer service what a bunch of b*******
Not a bad place. Love the karaoke and the wings are so great. Staff is also very friendly.

I really like this sports bar. Lots of TV sets and games running all the time. Karaoke nights on Saturdays i think, walked in and i was surprised. Tried their Italian menu and really liked it. They also have a good assortment of  alcoholic beverages, pool area and a casino i think. 1 star short because of the appetizers after 11 pm are not worth paying lol.

We have only been to music bingo but it is so fun, even if it consistently starts late. Deb is so friendly and a great bartender. She takes the time to mingle with everyone who sits at the bar and she is the highlight of every trip we have made. Have not tried the food but it always smells delicious.

I was one of a party of 13 for a birthday party on Saturday night.  Yep, I was odd man out again and in more ways than one as I will note in a bit.  We got started a bit after 7 and first we got our drinks and spent some time chatting and reading the menus.  Most of the folks there had been there several times before.  Everybody but me wanted pizza and wings so I ordered fettuccine Alfredo ($18.95) with salad and garlic knots.  I know it's un American not to be a fan of pizza and wings.  Their antipasta arrived and I sipped on my beer.  Then the pizzas came, then the wings followed by my pasta.  Somehow my order got separated from the rest and I had to ask for my salad and bread which finally came last.  The side salad wasn't earth shattering but was solid and the garlic knots were nice warm pieces of bread.  The pasta was delicious.  I mentioned I was not a fan of pizza or wings but I was coerced in to trying both a pepperoni pizza slice and a couple of Giovanni wings.  Both were really good, the pizza was a thin  crisp in spots crust.  The wings had none of the heat I normally associate with wings.  I had to take some of the pasta and bread home with me.  After dinner there was warm Zepellies and the birthday girl got this huge ice cream/brownie/whipped cream thing which her husband and I finished most of.  If you followed along, you will note I ate a lot of different stuff and I paid for it for several hours afterward.  For a large party we got quite good service except for my salad arriving late.  I just had the one beer (25oz) but most of the women were there to get their drink on and amongst them had several different mixed drinks and with one exception (weak) all were done well.  This is a big sprawling place with 2 bars and more TVs than I have seen outside of Vegas.  The original space which is sort of set off from the rest of the area has pool tables and darts.  There is a good sized outdoor area too.
Food and drinks were good.  Reasonably priced. Waitress was a little slow.  But otherwise a good experience.  Lots of tv's for everyone's sporty liking.

Anyone who knows me knows that this place is my favorite. Ashley R is AMAZING to say the least. I think their wings are HANDS down the best in the Valley. Ashley has always taken excellent care of me, and over time has gotten to know me. It's nice to walk in, find a table in her section and know she knows what I like and how I like it, and always makes sure my guests feel special. I would highly recommend Santisis for any sporting event; and Ashley R if she's availabke.
Good food not great. Good service. Cold beers. Good times. Great place to watch the games.

The most TV's under one roof anywhere.  This by far is the best sports bar in Phoenix.  Not only do they have a tone of tv's but the food is amazing.  I would go to this place if it had a black and white 19 inch TV just to get the food.  The owners did this place the right way, with the customer in mind!!  I will be a long time customer here till the day i die.
First time here tonight. Great atmosphere, excellent food and service. Can't wait to come back to watch some games and eat Amazing food!!
Back in the day this was the place to be. Now the service is terrible and it doesn't matter how many TV's you have if you can get a drink.
Awesome neighborhood joint.  Great wings,  delicious pizza and super friendly service! Love that you can watch pretty much any game at any time here, there are soooo many friggin tv's!

We come here a lot on Saturdays and love the service we receive from Kaci. She is fantastic and is very attentive. She makes our weekend .we love her very much. She even remembered when my birthday was and made me feel so special. She is one of the reason's we come to santisi brother's

Great place to watch UFC, but get there early a lot of people get there hours before and camp out until the fight. Luckily we were able to get a couple of chairs at the bar. The food was great and there were special pricing for appetizers,  food, and drinks on a Saturday night, major plus. The 10 inch pineapple ham with jalapeños was the best I've ever had. Yum!
TV's everywhere, good place to see everything!  Pizza was average.  Staff was nice and did a good job.

Soooooo many televisions! This place is March madness heaven. Getting the sound on for a specific game you are looking for is a bit of a challenge. Darts in the side bar is a ton of fun! Great service but prices of food and drinks are high. The price tag is the only thing that doesn't make this my home bar.

I love going to Santisis! First of all, it is in a very convenient location for me. The plaza it is in is kind of a dump, but it is close to my house and right off the freeway. Second, they have pretty good happy hour specials on drinks. They have huge beers at good prices...and they serve them in frost mugs! Last, there food is really good too. I love their pizza, wings, and salads. I have heard good things about their pasta too. They have lots of TVs to watch sports on but if you plan on going on Football Sunday, get there early or you won't get a spot!
Big SPORTS bar, decent drink choices, ton of food choices, good atmosphere for watching any sporting event.  I tried to count all the TV's: approx 78 different choices to watch.

Love this place! A TON of TVs. There is no bad seat in the house. Great place to watch football and plenty of seating. They have a buffet during football season that is a great deal and you can get pizza, hotdogs, wings. Their drinks are well made and service is fast and amazing considering how packed it usually is here. Overall all the food we have tried on the main menu has been good. Try this place out!

My boyfriend and I ordered the meatza pizza with bell peppers. And the sampler which included medium hot wings, angus beef sliders, and garlic knots. We waited about an hour for our food to come out. When it finally did, the sliders buns were really hard and the garlic knots were more wet and soggy than anything. The wings were pretty good and so was the pizza. Overall the pizza was the only thing hot, it was obvious the sampler had been made and sitting out for a while before it was brought to our table. I'm only giving 4 stars because I appreciate all the Available TV's and has a good atmosphere for watching sports. I don't think the food should be so pricey if the quality is so poor (the sampler cost $18.25). I didn't complain about my food because I had already waited so long and didn't want to bother waiting another hour.

I enjoy Santisi.  It is all boy and I love boys.    There are a gazillion TV's in this place, it is dark and cold, and the waitresses usually have some sort of fun tattoo or piercing for me to admire.  The food is also very good.    They have a good selection of beers on draft, my choice is usually a large Blue Moon although I've never had anything but beer here.  I've tried the garlic knotss, chicken fingers, pizza, philly chicken cheese sub and the Caesar salad.  Pizza or the Philly chicken would be hands down what I would suggest.  So, totally a bar food selection, but not too greasy and awful-ish.  Santisi's always seems to be packed, but you can usually find a seat if you come just a little bit before the big sporting event for the evening is slated to begin.    I usually come for a sporting event/dinner, and don't stay very late into the night.  I know they have a DJ some nights, karaoke, and quite a few dart boards.    Santisi is my friend.
Great spot to watch sports and play some pool. Had a great time!!!  Had the Philly Cheesestake Pizza. Very good!! Will be back!!

This is a great place to watch any game, ridiculous number of TVs all over the walls. The food is very good too. Nice place to play darts if you're into that. I really don't go here often enough.  Be warned it is a very busy and noisy place. Not good for kids. Otherwise, highly recommended

I just received an email from the owner of Santisi Brothers.  I love this personal touch of service and greatly appreciate a business owner taking the time to address a concern I have.  While it is not always easy to relay an issue at an establishment, Yelp has been a great tool to get across any frustrations.  John Santisi wrote to me today thanking me for my business and Since Santisi Brother has numerous exits, they have had a significant problem with walk outs.  In short, people have taken advantage of the business.    I don't like have to leave a credit card prior to ordering, but I understand the issue and believe that it is a legitimate way to control losses.  Plus, if it keeps prices down...then no worries.  Long story short...still love Santisi Brothers and will return often.  When asked for my credit card up while ordering... i will hand it over with an understanding smile.

My local spot. And I'm not even that local. But it's worth going to being in anthem. They have the hottest bartenders and servers and drinks are awesome. On my last visit Delaney was  the bartender and she made all  of our shots perfect. Always had a drink in front of me and even convinced me to order a sampler platter when I wasn't full. Had the Philly sliders, chicken fingers  and cheeseburger sliders and they were bomb. Great food and an awesome selection of anything u could desire. Grip of TV's so u can always watch whatever u want. Even soccer, which is my fave. They play the fights and have a dope game room with all the fun stuff . Go here. It's fly
Best food and pizza.....love the trivia there....Great beer and friends!!

Yum! Came here for Happy Hour on a Friday.  I would have given this place 5 stars if the beers on the menu were actually the beers they offered. I asked for Moose Drool since it was on the menu, but the waitress said they didn't have it and rattled off the beers they DO have. Nothing irritates me more than having something on the menu but not actually having it available.  The Giovanni Wings were out of this world. So flavorful. Just the right amount of crispness. Delicious!  Prices weren't bad at all. I'll definitely be back!

We were a bit skeptical when we pulled up but we're glad we have this place a shot. Our waitress was beyond friendly and the food was very good! We had wings, chili, French dip and a Philly cheesesteak (there was 5 of us). Everything came out hot and was tasty! We even had their homemade brownie and cookie for dessert. They were so good! Great place to watch and game and have yummy food!

Where to start? The waitress was nowhere to be found most of the time and then messed up the drinks repeatedly. As far as the good was concerned (once we FINALLY got to order) the bbq pork sandwich was decent (a bit on the spicy side if you get the Giovanni bbq sauce) and the slaw was nothing special.  Now for the good. The entire inside of the building is wrapped in TVs showing nothing but sports. Seems like this would be the place to go to watch almost any game you wanted.

So this place has the best food ever. We love to get their appetizer platter, the Alfredo is amazing, and they have awesome chicken sammies! Went in there recently and they were pretty busy. Our server asked if I wanted a refill on my soda so I said sure. I got the bill and they charged me again...for 2 sodas. I asked and she said oh ya you didn't read that it says on the menu you get 1 refill.  Now I understand that when there is a fight or game people might sit there for hours and if they gave unlimited refills that could get crazy. ALTHOUGH the cup is 32 oz. it was 28 oz of ice and 4 oz of soda. No I didn't read that on the menu I had just ordered the soda...I wouldn't have ever thought of paying twice since she offered I assumed it was free. Don't offer, or be sure to say it is an extra charge. That was very disappointing.

I am VERY impressed by the owners of this establishment. I did an order off of Grubhub last night for some pizza, one of the toppings I paid extra for wasn't on the pizza. I wasn't concerned at all just wanted to have the fee removed. Pizza was DELICIOUS might I add even without the topping. Anyways, I contacted grubhub to have the fee removed. The owner called me directly waived the entire order charge (absolutely did not have to do that but it is appreciated, greatly) and sent a gift card to come back and try the restaurant. Not only will I do so but I will continue to order long after the gift card is used up. Extremely impressed. You can tell the brothers care greatly about their brand and I fully support that! Way to go! And the food again was great!!

Pretty surprising for a sports bar. Excellent variety, higher end quality and consistency with everything we've tried here! Even their steamed veggies are amazing. Try their honey medium spicy wings! Bomb! Great service and drinks.

We ordered delivery from Santisi Brothers tonight (through Grub Hub) and were not impressed. Pizza was average, arrived close to cold, and hamburger with sweet potato fries underwhelming. Ordered the fries extra crispy - they were soggy and cool to the touch... not a bit of crunch. (Skimpy on the portion as well.) Pretty sure they didn't read the special instructions at all. Also, the burger was supposed to come with lettuce and tomatoes - there was no tomato.

Good food, bad service and please keep your opiinions to yourself!  I visited this bar because I heard about the good atmosphere, food, and the number of TV's for the many sports you can watch.  I favorite thing is that it cooks that good old world Italian food.  I lived in Kansas City where there is a good amount of Italians there and being in Arizona that food seems hard to find.  Santisit's has that good Italian family food packaged in a sports bar and not the traditional Italian family restaurant.  Kudos for that now on to the next.    I visited this place twice over the last week and have received bad service and got insulted on the second visit.  On 07/19 with my fiancee.  We ordered a antipasto salad and a stromboli.  We arrived at 3pm and did not receive our order until 3:45.  I believe the only reason we received that because they over heard the conversation that I was going to leave if the food was not out by 3:45.  I was surprised it took so long to bring the food out and especially a salad.  They could have just brought that out first since that was so simple to make.  We were out on Lake Pleasant that day out in the hot sun for about 4 hours and we grew an appetite.  However, we received the food and it was great.    I visited this place again on 07/23 for happy hour after doing some after hours work and I felt really insulted by the bartender that day and I didn't finish my food that day.  I arrived at there around 5:30pm and order a Michelob Ultra and a stromboli again.  Keep in mind that I am a heavyset guy and my bartender was a skinny 130lbs older lady probably around in her 50's.  She brings my order and looks at the plate and makes a remark saying, "That would last me about 3 days".  I did not understand why she said that but I paid it no mind until I was ready to go.  I only ate half of the plate and when I asked her to package my plate she makes another remark, "I'm suprised you didn't eat the whole thing".  I left the place shocked and insulted.  It took a lot to keep me from cursing this lady out.  I could not believe that she would inpose her opinion on me because I'm heavyset that I just gouge food.  I know that there is a LOT of peope here who gets crazy about this FAT phobia but if it does not affect you, the please don't worry about it.  It's my life and I can do what I want to do.  In addition, you are not a medical professional and you don't know why a person is overweight to begin with.  Even the doctor's themselves do not completely know what causes a person to be overweight becasue if they did 80 percent of adult Americans would not be fat.    This bar really pissed me off and I will not ever go back there again.  On the first time, shame on me but a second time, shame on you.  If the food wasn't good I would probably rate this place a one star.  Please train your staff to pay attention to your customers and be more couretous.  Thanks.

Loved it! Loved it! Loved it!  Authentic food and a great staff! Ashley the bartender was simply fantastic and I so enjoyed the garlic knots and Stromboli she recommended to have...   I can see why the place was packed, it is LEGIT!

I've been coming to Santisi brothers for many years now. I've never been disappointed in their food or service. It's a great sports bar with fantastic wings and pizza. It's not your typical sports bar. They have tasty ribs, sliders and pasta dishes to name a few. Make sure you try their Giovanni sauce on your ribs or wings which has a sweet spicy flavor. Last night I had the chicken tenders which was made to perfection lightly battered with the chicken tender and moist. Don't even ask me about their soups...all homemade.  Do yourself a favor and check out Santisi Brothers. Did I mention this was a sports bar, lol.

Not great people. Go to a better bar please! They lie! Our DD was 20 years old. We wanted to be safe and not drink and drive. To the best of my knowledge there isn't a law stating someone under the age of 21 needs to leave the establishment by 12pm. Regardless our DD left and I said "I don't think that's the law but ok". I was kicked out for arguing with the bartender "Jessica". I asked for the manager prior to being kicked out because Jessica suggested we talk with him. Jessica informed the manager that I didn't provide my Id and that is why I was being kicked out. I provided my Id to both "Jessica" and "Johnny". After which we continued to play pool. A few moments later "Johnny" came back to tell us we still needed to leave. He claimed she was the owner and we were being kicked out. I find it odd the owner needed to grab a manager when I asked for one rather than explaining she was the owner. Very bad experience and uncalled for. If they claim I had too many to drink well, I am pretty sure if I did I wouldn't have remembered the names given to me nor such a sour experience 2 days later. On the service side it was actually not the best but also not the worst. We sat for long periods of time before seeing our waitress/ bartender.
Great pizza & wings! Good happy hour deals after work.

Came in to watch a Broncos game with the ol ball and chain.  She's not as big of a fan of the Santisi Girls as I am.  Pizza was fairly ok and the wings were very meaty.  Overall pretty good, but nothing spectacular food wise.  Lots of TVs and anything you want is probably on one of them.

Each time I have gone to Santisi, the pizza has been very good, with a good balance of sauce, cheese, and toppings. The beers are always cold and fresh with a good selection of crafts beers available. The pies are large enough to split and the waitstaff is friendly.  Maybe not the best place for a date, because the number of televisions is a bit over the top. If you are craving good pizza, then you can't go wrong with Santisi's.

I used Postmates to order BBQ wings and a burger with fries. The wings were good, but far from amazing. However, the burger was really gross. It tasted kind of chewy which makes me believe they used some freezer burn pattys or something. It certainly wasn't fresh at all. Then the fries were cold. I don't live too far from this place and I don't blame the delivery man because they were very cold and floppy. It seemed like they had a big of cheap frozen fries and didn't bother cooking them all the way. I wish I could have sent back the entire order even though the wings were good. I just didn't have the time to do it and a waste of money.
good pizza with too much sauce and too much cheese, great crust very friendly wait staff 115 TVs!

Since I was 21 this has been our spot. To this Day the Wonderful Bar tender Deb remembers me.  I have moved miles away and my visits have become fewer but damn do i love the food and drink here. Huge Beers and nothing bad on the menu unless you put anchovies on it. Great Place!

Erica is simply the best.  Takes care of the tvs, always has glass full, always suggests the best foods, even though I have my favorites by now;    The sampler, the pork chops , the pizza, and always my Midwest games.    But then there's Erica. .

Love Santisi's! Ok, so it gets freaking crowded on Football Sunday, I mean like lines waiting for the place to open, and still not being able to get a seat, if you are in said line!  But there is a reason for it!  I mean it was like when they were decorating, they said, "hmm, what should we do with this part of the wall here?"..."Oh, we can fit another tv".  The floor to ceiling TV wall is a sight to see, ang big to little, quite funny looking.  I went for the 2nd round of games one Sunday, and they did an audience reaction over the loud speaker to find out which game would be played.  That was pretty cool!  Everything I've ever had from Santisi's is fantastic, best bar food catergory at least! Not original and gourmet fantastic. I especially love the Pasta a la Santisi, or something along that line!  The Pizza is pretty good too!  The chicken tenders are definitely homemade and huge, I mean when I'm explaining them to some one I say it looks like they took a chicken breast sliced it in half and then battered and fried them.  So GOOD.  The onion rings are dipped in the same batter, and when you bite into them for the first time, you don't end up pulling the entire onion out!  Love it!  I am not a big beer fan, so of course I stick the typical light beers, but I do know their isn't a huge selection, so if you are looking out side of Blue Moon and Fat Tire, you will not be satisfied.  But I will say, they do a dang good job at keeping your mugs icey cold, and this is a deal breaker for me.  They used to have a deal that started at like 10pm with the tall mugs, it was pretty cheap!
This place is always great! Great food. Great drinks. Great wings!!! They always change the TV to accommodate. Happy is the best becuase it's cheap!

First off Yelp is the best! Customers don't lie! Well me and my fiancé are from Cali and we came across Santisi thanks to yelp. Got the meaty pizza and onion rings... It was incredible. Best onion rings we've ever had and pizza was delicious! Great sports bar with wall to wall TVs! Definitely comin back next time!

I was pleasantly surprised when I walked into the door to see as many TV's as I did in one place. If you cant find the sports you are trying to watch at Santisi Bros, it aint on TV!! They got everything sports on screen, AWESOME! We had the Friday ALL-U-CAN-EAT Fish Fry and Boy did I LOVE THAT FISH!  It was breaded just like Fried Chicken Mom used to make, the Tarter sauce and the cocktail sauce was Perfect for the Fish! Only con about the meal was the French Fries, they were ok, but you definitely have to use Ketchup. I know a lot of places have fries that are so tasty that you dont need Ketchup, these are NOT those. Just like others have said its not a place to go if you are wanting to talk to someone or have a first date, it is VERY LOUD inside. The waitresses were very very pleasant and we felt very comfortable! Overall I would definitely recommend and I will be going back.

Never have I been to a pizza / bar in Az better then here and I can't believe it's taken me 20 ish years to finally give this spot a whirl.  Pros:   Great Pizza, Cheap Beer, Waitresses that don't stank, great appetizers, decent prices, perfect ora, Great UFC bar, you can even bring your mom and dad here :)  Cons: I'm not there with a cold draft in my hand   The S. Bro's pizza combo was legit, heck everything we had tasted good and was hot.  The guy next to me smashed his king crab legs so I am sure you can find something you like here.   It's worth your time, see ya there!     edit : 9/25/ 11  I have been there a few times since and the service has been lacking. I wish the staff would pay more attention, especially during the lunch rush. I noticed they like to bunch up and talk and when you only have 30 minutes to eat and you can't get your check it tends to tick me off.    - asked for ranch and received a snappy response  - people next to us tried to combine tables and was met by a rude waitress telling them they can't do it and almost to the point of yelling at them gave them no option except sitting in tables next to each other in a snappy fashion.   meh, I have experienced better

I have been going to Santisi's for years even though it is a bit out of my way. It is a great place to watch a game, however many people feel the same way so it is often packed, especially during a big game. Finding a table can be difficult. If you are with a group I highly suggest going early and camping out until the game starts.  Drink prices are a little high for a sports bar... but not too obscene. Mixed drinks are nice and strong.   Most of the food is awesome. Pizza is good, so are garlic knots, fried zucchini, and pizza bread. My husband loves their chicken fingers as well. But the BEST item they have are their calzones. OMG!! They are the BEST calzones in the valley. They are great even without any toppings, just cheese. Nice and crispy on the outside, perfectly seasoned, with very fresh tasting ricotta and mozzarella on the inside. Heaven. And they are huge. Can easily feed two people, especially if you share an appetizer or salad also. All their food is reasonably priced, however I wish they had appetizer specials for happy hour. I would drive over there way more often if they did.   Service is good most of the time. At its worst its just decent. One time we waited 45 minutes for our food including an appetizer sampler. It arrived at the same time as our calzone. And it was lukewarm. :(  Um, I think appetizers should take 10 or 15 minutes tops to get to your table and it should be HOT...    That said, Santisis is a perfect place to eat some delicious food while watching a game. Highly recommended.

My boyfriend, friend and I went in last night to play some pool, have a few beers and watch the warriors game. It was a good time; service wasn't too bad, ordered an appetizer (the only thing we ordered) and everyone ate it all! Tasted good at the time until the next day when we all 3 got food poisoning! Completely horrible day it was for us, so I wanted to be nice and call to inform the manager we all got food poisoning for the appetizer (not wanting any money back or trying complain about it) So the first employee who answered the phone was rude when she answered and was busy so I was put on hold, 2 different people picked the phone up to see what I was on hold for. I just wanted to speak to a manager and when I finally spoke to one, she was rude as well; and kept saying we make the food all fresh and that's impossible because no one else called about having food poisoning AND FINALLY SHE HUNG UP ON ME! Completely blown away by the management and how they handled the situation, I spent days and nights and lots of money at this place until today! You lost all of our service!!!

We have been coming here every Wednesday for about a year. We get great customer service from Debbie which is the reason we come back time and time again. We have never had anything on the menu that we didn't like! We especially love the pizza and the wings! Giovanni sauce is the best! I would recommend this place to anyone and we try to bring everyone we know here! Love Santisi Brothers

I had high hopes for this place but man was I let down! Went there with a Groupon for carryout  yesterday and got a pizza and wings. Figured that would be a good way to judge it. I got there about 10 minutes after my order was ready only to wait about another 15 minutes to get my food (pizza wasn't keyed in right, manager took about 10 minutes to show up to type in my Groupon, waitresses had no organization to get my order, etc). Then after we got home and ate some(which you could tell by the temp my food had been sitting for some time), both of us have MASSIVE food poisoning today. I can't speak for him but it was the only thing I ate yesterday so they're is no doubt Santisi's 100% gave me food poisoning AFTER horrible service...

Came here to watch the Cards game with some friends a couple weeks back.  Loved that there were lots of TV's playing different games so you could find a good spot no matter where you were sitting or who you were rooting for.  The food was great too, I got the White Pizza which was delicious.  Service was pretty quick too considering how packed the place was.  Definitely enjoyed the place and would go back again for sure.

Wow, I can't believe I haven't written a review for Santisi Brothers yet. We've been going to this sports bar for yeeeeeeeears. Not so much for watching sports, but the food is great. My husband loves wings and his favorite are from this joint. He'd marry them if he wasn't already married to me.   Unless you come at an off time, it is ALWAYS busy. Service can sometimes be slow, but you can easily keep yourself entertained with the gazillions of TVs or Buzztime games (the trivia ones are my favorite). Once, our server forgot to bring the gamebox my husband requested, so he gave her a B+ on the receipt. She's remembered us each time she's served us since then, and brings the box without us asking. Hahahah.  Along with the wings, most everything on the menu that we've tried has been tasty. The pizza is good, as well as the anitpasto salad, chicken caesar salad, minestrone soup and garlic knots! If you're in the mood for BBQ, you MUST have something with Giovanni's sauce - perfectly tangy sweet with a spicy kick. Ribs are my favorite, but it's also awesome on grilled chicken breast or on wings. Beer prices are decent and they have cider on tap - delicioso!   There is a room with pool tables and darts, although I've hardly ever sat in that area, plus patio seating out front. Sometimes it's kinda cold inside, but maybe I've just been sitting directly under a vent or something. Regardless, definitely recommend Santisi Brothers!

My favorite sports bar in Phoenix. The food is a slight step up from regular sports bar food: they have a great variety of Italian food. The price is slightly pricey (more than $10 for a pasta dinner), but the portion sizes are big so you get your money's worth. I've tried the baked ziti and there was a good balance of sauce and cheese. The 10'' personal pizza is perfect for a single person: if you're a big eater it should fill you up. I usually get the Santisi Combo w/ pepperoni, sausage and peppers. I also went here a couple of days ago and ordered a cheese calzone, which was very big and could be shared with another person. Their garlic knots are also a must have with every meal: they're not too soggy like the pizza chains and go great with marana sauce.  The ideal place to sit is on the main part of the restaurant with all the televisions (opposite of the game room with the pool tables). I've been here during NFL conference championship weekend and during March Madness and they do a good job showcasing the games people want to see. On a typical Sunday for football, you'll see the big games on the bigger screens and other sports like golf/tennis/soccer on others. They'll even show niche sports like MMA so that is a big plus for me.

Love Santisi Brothers, we generally visit once a week. Great potato skins and great pizza! We've tried lots of different items in the menu they were all very tasty. They have tons of tv's up with all sorts of different games and trivia to keep you busy and a bar side as well where you can play billiards or darts and get a little rowdy! The staff does a great job and are very friendly and like to get know their regulars.

This seems like a very local place. I stopped by because I was in the area and was craving wings. It is a bar with a LOT of tv's. Don't go here if you have epilepsy. Anyway, the bartender was very friendly and hooked me up with a dozen amazing wings. They were excellent. They also have a large menu with a lot of other good looking items. If I'm in the area again, I'll be back.

Good place, dark, tons of TVs and great food, I like to sit in the restaurant area because it has more to view, and the bar area seems to be full of D-Bags but that's just me. But since it is close to home it's always up there on places to go when you want a quick drink or some bar food.
I will come here every single time I am in town .. the place won my heart over as soon as I walked in and made my stomach so happy. Worth every penny

DO NOT come here if there is a UFC event and you want to watch literally any other sport.   We came to watch UNC/Duke basketball game (one of the, if not THE biggest, college sports rivalry. We thought with the sheer number of TVs at this place we would have no problem watching this game. Wrong. 100% of the large TVs and almost all of the small TVs were tuned into UFC, even though most people didn't seem to be paying it much attention. Also important to note, this was NOT a pay per view event, which I would be more understanding of. This was on fox sports, aka big whoop.  We found a table and asked the waitress if she could change the TV directly in front of us, she said no but that we could change any of the small (very    small) TVs. I saw a spot at the bar closer to a small TV so my husband asked the lady at the bar if we could change it to our game (it was on a hockey match nobody was watching), and she said she was just *about* to turn it to UFC (as if every other dang TV in the place wasn't already tuned in lol). We immediately decided this was not the place for us and sought another sports bar.   Really poor customer service, no attempt was made to accommodate us. They've definitely lost our business for any future spring training visits.

Great place to watch a game, there are tv's in every direction. This place is huge with lots of seating. Their prices are very reasonable, so won't spend yourself silly if you watch a game or fight here.

This is probably my favorite pizza place on this side of town. There is something for everyone here. Pizza, burgers, chicken, salads, wings, BEER . You get my drift. We came for an early dinner and with wall to wall TVs there's guaranteed something for everyone to watch. I love coming in on Friday nights for their karaoke bingo. There's pool tables as well so yet again there are so many things to keep you busy. Today we ordered a large pizza and a dozen hot wings. I'm kinda a wuss so I'd rather eat mild, but my husband lives for everything and anything hot so we chose the hot. I ate a few which which all I could handle. The pizza is always amazing. I recommend the garlic knots and fried zucchini if you're looking for an appetizer. It's s better deal if you chose a two item or three item combo appetizer, but you better be hungry because it's a lot of food!

I've been goin in here for quiet some time now and I love it! Between the wings, pizza, and calzones they have the best of the best!! The service is amazing and you truly feel like family!!! Delanie helped me the last time and as always I was more than satisfied with EVERYTHING!!! I'll be a customer for like that's for sure

We used to eat here a lot and recently thought we'd try the uber eats app. We ordered a large peperoni pizza, 24 giovani wings, 2 7pc strip meals with giovani sauce, coleslaw and salad. Total order came to $70 ish with delivery fees.   I'll start by saying their food is usually top notch and high quality. Everything from their huge calzones to appetizers are excellent. This order has me wondering though. Our wings were luke warm, minuscule in size, and under sauced. Love the flavor of giovani sauce though. On to the pizza. The only complaint here was the temp. Again luke warm at best. The 7pc strip orders were soggy, warm, and under sauced again.   I'm gonna chalk this up to a combination of skimping on quality (size of wings) to save money. The fact that we were also the second stop on uber eats trip cost the food some temperatures. If you order from here, I suggest you call it in and pick it up your self. This will not only save you some money, it will save you some quality as well. We will most likely order from here again, but we'll skip delivery and the tiny wings.

This is by far my favorite watering hole. I was introduced to this place by my friend Lyneah almost 5 years ago. I have been coming back here religiously, primarily due to one amazing rockstar of an employee named Delanie. I now frequent this local hot spot at least 4 times a week. This place is the unicorn of sports bars. It has an amazing staff, food, sporting events, and a great core of locals that call this place home. I am here so much, I have my mail sent here. Come give it a try, you won't be disappointed. *sorry could not list all the employees

You walked in the door and you were immediately greeted by which seems to be 100 televisions all showing sports. The bike is great here, and the food seems to be really good. This would be a really fun place for watching the big game! Looking forward to coming back again.

AMAZING service  AMAZING food AMAZING ambience  LOVE the TV walls LOVE the galaga machine LOVE the claw machine LOVE the wall art in the bathroom. It says "it's a beautiful life." If you're an employee/manager/owner can you tell me where you got it?! I need it for my house! Keep up the great work! This place is always a great time!

So I used to come here quite often when I lived in the area but it had been awhile, I had lunch with my parents a few weeks back and dinner with my dad last night for fish Friday. It was PACKED! However even with the amount of people there the service was on point! I wish I remembered her name but I can't, tall slender blonde, she was very attentive and made sure we were taken care of! Food was good my first time having the fish and portions are big! Comes with Cole slaw which typically I don't like but this one was good, also fries. All in all everything was good and I'd definitely come back for the fish!

For all the people that haven't had the Fettuccine Alfredo or the baby back ribs. YOU HAVEN'T EATEN AT SANTISI'S!  These two dishes are the best in town! The pizza is good, the wings are good.  But these two are F···Ing amazing!  I bring new people here all the time (some from Chandler) and everyone talks about how they can wait to go back.  If you ask the owners what you should have, they will say the same thing. Best things on the menu!   Meatballs are right up there too! The owners Mom  comes in every day and makes them fresh!   I don't live anywhere near the place, but it's a regular stop for me.

Always enjoy this place especially on Wednesday and Saturday nights with the crab leg specials. Crab legs are served fresh and gets us very fool, the beer is super cold. Last time we were there, I ordered the nightly special 25oz Blue Moon brewski, darn it was good! My sister and brother and law weren't aware of the special so they ordered the traditional in a bottle Heini, then gave me crap about it all night that I was drinking a pitcher of beer and it was practically a 12-pack lol! I told them "oh be quiet, if you guys knew of the special you would of ordered the same thing". Love the atmosphere, little too noisy and gets a little crowded but kid friendly.

We show up to watch the Cardinals game for breakfast with the kids and this joke of a place had only two TVs in the dining area showing the Cardinals game. The tables are all saved by people crowded around the two tvs. this is an Arizona sports bar? Really? Meanwhile they have all this Cardinals signage up.
